amazing guy, and very nice, but the lectures are kind of redundant, keeps going over stuff that was covered last week and that took over half of the 2-hour lecture. repeats himself a lot, I try not to mind it, but it gets annoying to the point where I just skip the lecture entirely and just print out the slides.

Doesn't provide rubrics for the assignments so it's hard to tell what you lost points on. TAs that are grading don't give much information on this (granted, they're grading like 400 people). People lost points on discussions for not having enough words/paragraphs but everyone followed what he wanted (1-2 paragraphs on most)

I loved taking Professor Cahn's class. He is very passionate about food and the assignments he assigns often are quite interesting. There is a weekly Carmen post with two small essays and then the final essay. Overall was a very good class and would definitely take it again if I could.

I really loved Dr. Kahn. He only requires you to listen to his lecture. Then every week there is a short discussion post over what you learned. There are also two essays that are the equivalent of an exam. They are both super easy if you listen to the lectures. He will help you with your essay as well if you send it to him early. Would recommend!

Pretty interesting class overall, although the overall theme of the content started to get a little repetitive towards the end of the semester. The class is online asynchronous so I never met Dr. Cahn but he seems like a very nice guy and just genuinely wants his students to leave the class having learned something. Easy A, no stress GE.

Dr. Cahn is notably passionate about global food and technology history; his lectures are comprehensive and engaging, and the weekly assignments (discussions) are thought-provoking and helpful for constructing your final paper. If you watch the lectures, complete the discussions, & start early on your essays (2 total), you'll easily pass.

The entire class is graded on 8 assignments: 6 weekly discussion posts and 2 relatively short papers. The course itself is interesting and Dr. Cahn has a clear passion for what he teaches. If you make an effort in this class, you will do well. Dr. Cahn is also really personalable and forgiving; he understands the stress that students go through.

Easily the hardest history class I have ever taken. Dr. Steigerwald is brilliant and knows 1968 like the back of hand. Sometimes it was a little hard to keep up with him. There was a ton of writing for this class as the final paper was 18-20 pages. He gives a lot of feedback on your writing and it can sometimes feel blunt and but it's super helpful

David is a gifted lecturer and incredibly knowledgeable, add to that he's beyond reasonable about his expectations of students. Be prepared, his feedback on writing assignments can be blunt and biting, but its always given as a way to help the student cultivate great habits in writing going forward. Very rational, considerate, level headed guy.

Professor Steigerwald is the best professor I have had at Ohio State. His lectures were extremely interesting, I was on the edge of my seat for every class. He knew every students name in the massive lecture hall. I found myself gravely upset realizing that I would not be attending one of his lectures next semester. Would take again.

Dr. Steigerwald is by far my favorite professor at Ohio State. He is a fantastic educator, mentor, and overall person. He is understanding and flexible, wants you to succeed, and chooses great readings. He is also not afraid to give corrective criticism on your writing, but is very approachable if you want help.

Prof Steigerwald makes an effort to get to know each of his students. His lectures are interesting and the extent of his knowledge is impressive. He doesnt give exams, just quizzes, two essays and a book review. The content is interesting so I enjoyed writing the essays. Theres also readings and participating in discussion will help you out
Lots of reading and writing, but he gives great feedback and is always willing to help!

Dr. Steigerwald is one of the best professors I've had at OSU. He made history lectures engaging, based a lot of the class on what the students wanted to discuss out of the readings, and provided really great feedback. He was understanding and flexible. The class is very reading heavy and consists a fair amount of writing but is manageable.

If you take history of the sixties, you'll most likely have a huge paper to write... Do NOT choose the topic "second wave feminism." Despite following ALL of his feedback, I never got above a B on a paper. Sorry if you're not a feminist, but disagreeing with a paper doesn't mean it wasn't written well. Pretentious author-of-the-textbook professor.

In the time of Covid-19, Professor Steigerwald was the most flexible professor I experienced. He adjusted the original workload in the syllabus by making our second essay optional. Be prepared to write, and have that writing meticulously critiqued. He remembers your style of writing vividly and will keep track of what needs work. He wants to help.

I'm about to graduate in a few days and I have never written a review for a professor ever, but Dr. Steigerwald is the absolute best. I've taken four of his classes and he has been such an awesome mentor for me. Show up, engage in the class, engage with him, and you'll do great. He wants to see everyone succeed and will help anyone out. 10/10 guy.

Best professor I have ever had. Had professor Steigerwald last fall for a class titled "The Sixties". The class wasn't an easy "A", but his lectures were so entertaining!! The material was also interesting. Hands down my favorite professor of all-time. It would be a disservise to yourself to not experience what great teaching looks like.

He is genuinely such a nice and caring professor. He has asked us multiple times if the workload is appropriate. Carmen didn't submit my response once and he was completely understanding. He has a sense of humor, is open-minded about ideologies and gives amazing feedback on written papers.

Really nice and funny guy when you give him a chance. He is so smart I found myself getting lost sometimes. I took his research seminar and I was stressed the whole semester because none of us could intellectually keep up with him, but at the end of the day he wants you to do well and his grading is fair and not too hard.

Steigerwald's lectures are interesting to the point I won't even check the time during class and before you know it, it's over. Easy quizzes if you take notes and do the reading, very particular about papers but gives extensive feedback and genuinely wants to improve student's writing. I'm hoping to take another class with him!

His lectures were interesting but some of the information seemed questionable. 6 online quizzes; drops the lowest one. 2 papers. Rough drafts easy to get full points. Final papers good luck in trying to please him. Gives a lot of feedback but it's unclear so not helpful.  No outside research allowed. Your opinion must match his or you lose points.

Dr. Steigerwald is a professor that will go above and beyond to help you out. He really cares about his students and wants everyone to succeed. If you're struggling with anything at all during his class just reach out to him! Also, his lectures are incredibly engaging. I am a history major but I always recommend this to non-majors looking for a GEC

I'm not a history major, but 3015 is my favorite class I've ever taken. He teaches the subject matter in a really interesting way and is awesome at giving feedback on papers! He even is willing to review drafts before the paper is due. All around a great professor teaching interesting content!

SUPER helpful. HIGHLY recommend him. He knows what he's talking about, his lectures are very helpful and the slideshows show what you need to be writing down. EXTREMELY willing to help meet with you outside of class, including on the weekends, to help you understand the material and work on the papers due for the class. HIGHLY RECOMMEND

(3312, not on RMP list)
Good guy and solid prof. He talks really fast so be prepared to either have a hand cramp or revisit some slides later. Because he gets through lectures quick, class usually got out 15-20 minutes early. Extremely versed on African history and passionate about the content. All required readings posted online. Very easy grader.
You will not learn much of anything from him and he is unwilling to help his students out. Just an overall terrible professor.

Even though the class was entirely online due to COVID, I did learn a lot from the readings and online forums. The content was very interesting, but you do have to read some very long and slow passages. It is a pretty easy A though.

Class is normally cut short, but not unreasonably. Always provides extra insight as to which lectures to focus on for quizzes and is available upon request to assist with papers if one is question the criteria or what direction to take. Overall enjoyable class and very nice professor, am taking another course with him!

Dr. Sikainga clearly knows his stuff and the content of his classes is very interesting. The class was not engaged but thats not his fault. Some said he was boring but everyone understood that he was a fair grader. I liked him a lot, and I would take a class with him again!
Hes a great teacher. His content is actually extremely interesting and if you show up to clsss then youll pass. Hes very nice and tries to connect with students but the class was quiet.

Just by showing up to class and paying attention, you will likely easily pass this course. The criteria for each quiz and exam are clear. My class bombed a quiz and he was nice enough to offer a makeup quiz. Nice guy, interesting subject, he wants you to participate with the material and by doing so you'll easily pass
He posts the power-points from lecture online and they contain everything that are on the quizzes and in the books. He even tells you what power-points to look at for each quiz and the final.

Lectures feel ungodly long as he reads line by line from his power point.  He knows his stuff but is incapable of relaying any information in a clear and interesting way.  Also readings are long and pointless, I was better off making crap up for exam.  So yeah don't even think about taking this class. You will regret it.

All he did was simply read off the powerpoint. Really no point in going to class even though he does take regular attendance. He's also not very helpful. Most of the time, you will not find him at office hours or get replies back from email. Super late in posting grades. He's knowledgable it seems but did not learn a lot. Would NOT recommend at all
Doesn't explain assignments, never went over the syllabus, readings are long and irrelevant

It is important to stay awake since most of his information doesnt even come from the books.  For the tests though, he requires outside information from the books, and if you dont use it, you wont get a very good grade on the exams.  He is extremely intelligent and knowledeable if you want to discuss things with him outside of class.

Dr. Sikainga's class was disappointing at best. Most of my classmates agreed that he seemed not to want to be teaching our course, which was evident through consistently late arrival, unreasonably early dismissal, dull lectures, zero discussion, and minimal to no outside assistance. Don't take this class if you actually want to learn something.

Prof Otter was my favorite professor all semester and might be my favorite so far here at OSU. The lectures are long and some can be boring, but he tries to make them funny and his accent is hilarious. 3 essays for 60% of the grade all 3-5 pages. Final essay is 8-10 pages and worth 40%. First two essays can be re-written until they are a 100%.

The class was easy, with a total of 4 assignments. While the presentations were black text on gray backgrounds, he managed to make it enjoyable with his great sense of humor. I'd recommend this class and Otter if you need it for an easy elective/gened.

Pretty easy class, with four papers graded by the TA. If you didn't like your score on the first two, you could rewrite them. Otter has a good sense of humor and made the lectures that were comprised of "boring" information super engaging and interesting. Good class to take for a GE, or history credit.
Otter is an amazing professor, although I didn't particularly love the subject matter if you take Otter you'll learn and enjoy the class.

dr. otter cares a lot for his students. there are three 3 page papers and a 10 page final. you get unlimited rewrites on the first two. i took this as a ge and do not care about the content, but he made it enjoyable. i highly recommend if you dont mind writing

Professor Otter is top 3 of my favorite professors here at OSU. He makes the lectures interesting to learn about even though it's a history class. I have never written a ratemyprofessor review but I had to for him because he's the best history teacher I've had in a LONG time. Please take this class especially for a Theme course!

Great professor, very helpful and attentive. Learned a lot about a relatively boring subject (in my opinion) in a very interesting way.  Dr. Otter made what would usually be a very rough class to take one of the highlights of my day.

Chris Otter was hilarious, caring, and really made this class entertaining. I've never cared about history until this class! Your grade only rests on attendance and four papers though, so if you're not a good writer I would not recommend this course. It's also important to pay attention to the syllabus for the requirements for each of the papers.

Dr. Otter is awesome!  He is funny and keeps his lectures engaging by having class discussions.  Class has 3 shorter papers (3-5 pages) and one 10 page final paper.  The papers are graded hard, and the class takes a good amount of effort but if you put the effort in you will learn a lot!

Prof Otter is one of the best professors I have had at OSU. Even though papers can be a bit challenging, if you put a fair effort, he will give you a high grade. He's very friendly overall and he will make sure that you earn a fair grade based on the effort you put in.

Dr. Otter is a fantastic professor! Very knowledgeable about the history topics covered in the course. Course assignments consist of three shorter 3-5 page papers and one final term paper. He can be a tough grader, but he allows the first two papers to be rewritten. Be sure to utilize the readings in your papers; omitting them will hurt your score.

Professor Otter is very knowledgeable! He explained all of the material well for all of us to understand. I would say he was a tough grader at first but you're able to revise 2 of the 3 response papers. Assigns readings, but it goes along with what we learned in lecture. As long as you get used to how he grades and what he wants, you will do well!

Professor Otter is a great professor! Hes very knowledgeable and wants his students to succeed. However, he is also an extremely tough grader. I would not recommend this class if you want an easy A; youll spend a lot of time reading and writing. But if you want to get challenged and learn something new, Otter is the best person to learn from.

Professor Otter was a great professor, but his lectures progressively became less interesting. All students have to write their notes on paper (no electronics allowed unless SLDS) and it is beneficial when it comes to retaining information, but he talks really fast and does not leave his slides up for enough time.

Best professor ever. Attendance is mandatory but his lectures are amazing and you'll learn a lot. Three response papers and one final paper but he lets you re-write the first paper until you're satisfied and you can always ask him to read drafts and provide feedback. He genuinely cares about his students and works to make classes fun & interesting

Nicest professor ever!! Really cares about his students and is really willing to work with them regarding deadlines/assignments. Grades based on 3 papers each worth 20% of grade, 1 final paper worth 30%, and 10% attendance. No daily homework. Requirements of papers are clear. He tries to make the lectures as entertaining as possible

Chris cares so much about his students and it shows! Always responds to emails within the hour, sometimes less! Very personable & tries to gain student engagement. There is no electronics allowed in his classroom, but it is honestly beneficial because you use all your notes to write your papers. Very good guy, would recommend to anyone!

Dr. Otter was an amazing professor. He's very understanding of the fact that his students have many other obligations outside of his class. Assignments were very manageable. Grades in the class came from attendance and a few papers, but he allowed you to resubmit them as many times as necessary to get the grade you wanted. I would highly recommend.

Attendance was required, but the class is great. He was very interactive without making anybody feel awkward in discussions. There wasn't really any technology allowed and we took notes on paper, which helped me learn and retain information. There were 3-4 assignments total, all papers, but he was helpful and gave lots of feedback before grading.

He is absolutely FANTASTIC and EXTRAORDINARY. He is extremely intelligent and knows his fields of interests really well. Going to classes and listen to him lecturing in his beautiful British accent is just an enjoyment. If you pay attention to the paper requirements and do all the readings, you will learn a lot.

ONE OF THE BEST PROFESSORS IVE EVER ENCOUNTERED he is extremely knowledgeable. He is very kind and understanding with students conflicts. He is attentive and helpful when it comes to our papers. He is extremely funny and has such a vibrant bright personality that makes class entertaining and fun. Overall an amazing professor!I recommend history2703

I have mixed feelings about Chris. On one hand, he did his best to make extremely dry material interesting, and was a guy who cared about what he taught. Then again, when there's only 4 grades, and three of them are papers, it's hard to get a great grade. It's a decent amount of work for a history GE. Take it if you prefer papers over tests.

I took this class for my history GE and it was perfect. 3 4-5 page papers based on topics talked about in class, then one 10 page paper final. Attendance is part of the grade too. Papers are not hard as long as you put in the effort to write them with the right material. Pretty easy Class! Highly recommend. Very helpful and wants you to succeed!

Christ is a great professor! He is funny and makes the class interesting. He is always willing to help you and answer questions whether it's during class, outside of class, or by email. He exceptionally good about emailing back quickly. I wrote 4 papers for his class and there was no exam, which i loved. I would recommend Chris!

Great British accent.  Wrote a paper on how to write a paper; get the books to do the research but don't really do the research, just say how you would.  A couple book reports and papers, no tests.  Very easy if you read the books and are already a good writer.

This class was not on the most interesting topics but Chris made it do able. Attendance is mandatory, although I was not always mentally present(early) But his TA was a ridiculous grader. 2 4-5 page papers and 10 page final paper. Exam is half ids and half a paper....not looking forward to it..NOT AN EASY A!

Professor Otter is great. Lectures are informative and engaging. Very little book usage, several papers, a final paper and an exam. However, he had a TA who was a ridiculously hard grader, and I'm not sure I'll end up with an A despite my ridiculously high effort. Don't take if you're looking for an easy GE course.

Great teacher, actually made class super interesting and fun.  Takes attendance. 2 4-5 page response papers on assigned topics (pick from like 5 choices) and then a 10 page final paper on a topic of your choice.  Also a final that had identification of terms and then short essays.  Posts all notes online. Study from that. Take this class!!!!!!

Absolutely wonderful. If you get the chance to take him, do it. This class was simple: a midterm and final with essay questions you already knew before hand, a  research paper, and recitation participation. Funny guy with  a British accent, his lectures were actually enjoyable.

Nice, funny guy. Organized lectures and doesn't required textbook reading (has supplemental readings but you didn't have to read them to do well). He's the kind of guy you just sit back and listen to; he paints a great picture of history. Grade consisted of attendance, two papers and essay exam. Easy class, fun teacher.

Professor Otter is very great and enthusiastic. While we had a T.A. who graded our final/midterm and term paper, Prof. Otter's lectures were very, very fun and interesting. One can tell that he spends a great deal of time preparing slides etc.  He is extremely knowledgble on British-if you get the chance-take him!
Best and easiest history prof I have had.  His grading policy is very fair and he has an interesting lecture that I only attended just to listen to him speak.

Prof Otter is a good guy. i am SHOCKED he didnt get any hotness ratings? hes super cute and british! History of technology has 4 five pg papers and 1 ten pg paper.. which i didnt knowcoming into it.. kind of annoying. no tests. dont pay attention in class. no book. takes attendance every lecture :(

Very friendly guy. Has a sense of humor about history. The textbook use is low, only need it for the papers you write. No need to read the assigned readings because they are never discussed in class. Glad we could rewrite papers. Posted class powerpoints on Carmen for future reference which was very helpful. Final exam wasn't bad.

I had Professor Otter for History 398 and he made a mundane class extremely interesting. He was very interested in helping students and had an extensive knowledge of European history. If you have to take 398, take it with him. I will definitely take another class with Professor Otter!

I love this professor. He is very helpful and absolutely adorable, I love his accent! He is a very fair grader and he lets you rewrite your papers which is awesome. 398 info is rather boring, but he makes it as interesting as possible! I definately recommend him and will def take other classes with him.

The 1:48 long classes are usually the bane of my existence, by Professor Otter moved class along in a way that facilitated interesting conversation between students.   All in all, he found a way to make class enjoyable and profitable.

This was one of the more interesting history classes I have taken. The professor has an encyclopedic understanding of this time period. Material very relevant to modern US problems and politics. Grading and writing definitely reasonable.
Interesting teacher with English accent.  Lectures were pretty boring and not necessary.  Attendance to recitation is required.  Gives you the questions prior to the exams, which helps a lot.
No Comments

Easy teacher, only got an A- due to my laziness. Nice guy and very clear about stuff. The class was boring because it was 398 (How to research and write history) and he tried to make it as amusing as possible.

AWESOME! Take this professor if you can. I am a bio major, but I still got an A-. For his midterm/final, he gives a list of possible prompts. If you prepare for 3 or 4 of them, you're golden. Very easy grader.There's a ten page paper but it's not hard. There is a lot of reading, but I found that it wasn't necessary to actually read it.

I really did not enjoy taking this class. He never put any grades in and rambled on and on during lectures. He is very caring and appreciated whenever any students went to office hours or talked to him, but only when it was convenient for him. Really unclear what he wanted from essay assignments and the organization of the Carmen page was bad.

Professor Rivers was extremely interesting to listen to and learn from. Yes his lectures did ramble on, but if you paid attention and took notes the papers and exams were easy. My best advice is to go to his office hours. His communication through email is rough at best, but if you go to office hours he will explain everything.

Six papers overall, two outside of class FOUR in two separate tests (+long discussions). He will not grade anything and even if he reads your email he will not respond to it, even if he TOLD YOU TO. Lectures are rambling and if he is on topic it's because he's reading directly from the slide or his notes.

Dr Rivers is extremely knowledgeable in his field and I learned a ton in this class. He is very willing to work with students and even met on weekends to accommodate us. However, he is so inaccessible by email and will only respond on his time. His lectures are a bit scattered and often go off topic. Great guy, super smart, but not the best prof

He is kind but, has awful communication. We have finished classes for the year and I have no grades. Emailed him 4 times this week (asked in class several times) for grades, no response. Lectures go off topic every two seconds. Way too much content in carmen (he literally couldn't upload anymore items). Expects entirely too much in assignments.

I took 3620 over the summer online. It was Dr. Rivers' first time teaching online and he did really well. Course content was very interesting and he is very clearly passionate and educated on the subject matter. Two main essays that he was happy to go over and help, he was incredible.

I feel really bad giving him the score I did because he genuinely cares so much about what he teaches and I really did learn a lot. Here is the main issue: his communication is abysmal. I am NOT exaggerating when I tell you that I did not receive a single grade until the DAY grades were due and he did not respond to a SINGLE e-mail of mine.
Glad, I have him as my history professor. I learned a lot of stuff during lectures and I appreciate to give me an opportunity to complete all my assignment before end of semester.

Professor Rivers is a very knowledgeable and gives interesting lectures. I have taken two classes with him and overall the experience is very positive. He tries to cover history from a vast range of group but focuses a lot on lgbtq+ and Lesbian history. The class focuses a lot on primary sources from activist or queer people from these periods.

Dr. Rivers is a really great person, but a very poor professor. He does not lecture clearly, and ends up going off on tangents frequently. I do not feel that I learned anything, his papers and tests are unclear, and I did not feel prepared for any of it based on his lectures. He takes far too long to give feedback which is frustrating.

Rivers, even if he was hard to contact at times, is a great guy. It is obvious not only that he is interested in the material, but also that he cares a lot about the mental health and learning of his students. If you can put up with his inconsistency on emails, his class is 100 percent worth it. A plus is that the information is also interesting.

It's clear that Prof Rivers is very smart but he is probably the worst professor I've ever had. Never responded to anyone's emails, vague instructions for papers and exams,only gave us grades for the midterm(six weeks late and over email, still no grades in canvas at all) and has yet to grade any papers or the final. extremely disorganized

Prof Rivers did not respond to a single email I sent him the entire semester. He disappeared from class for weeks then posted lectures he recorded in the summer. Why it took him weeks to post pre-recorded lectures, I do not know. It is currently April 3, 2021 and this class is a SP21 and I have no grade in the class. He does not communicate at all.

He literally disappeared for my History class. We had maybe 5 assignments and then a Midterm (6 pages, single spaced...) and then a final paper (4 pages, single spaced). We had to contact the History Department chair to literally take over the class. He never responded to emails or anything: would not recommend.

The subject matter is interesting but the experience isn't worth it. He seems sweet but doesn't respond to emails, offer office hours regularly, and disappears for weeks. All assignments require a ridiculous amount of writing (ex. 2+ pages SINGLE SPACED/answer for papers). This class has brought me so much stress in an already stressful semester...

He literally doesn't respond to emails. Had to have the head of the history department step in for our class because he stopped posting assignments for 3 weeks. Midterm was brutal (so much work), and gave us even more work for the final before being told by others that it's a bad idea. When he came back after 3 weeks, he uploaded 68 files at once.

This class stressed me out so much during the pandemic! He would post PDFs on Carmen once a month and never answered emails. For weeks at a time he would never post anything on Canvas or communicate with anybody, he just went MIA.

Professor Rivers seems like a good guy, he just totally botched this semester. I understand it is his first time doing a class online, but he was missing in action for like 2 weeks. Not even exaggerating. His class was asynchronous and he only posted like 4 lectures. The midterm was 3 questions with one 2+ page paper each, single-spaced. Yikes.

Online class- waited 40 mins before class telling students that we are expected to do everything ourselves. Grades discussions late and post discussions late. I really like his lectures but this semester felt like a hot mess. I am not impressed with him.

Professor Rivers is an amazing lecturer! His lectures are heavy with information, so you really need to attend to get the information. There are assigned readings every week (to be discussed in recitation), but it's not too much. He provides the exam questions 2 weeks prior so that you can prepare your essay response. 10/10 recommend!

Dr. Rivers is very knowledgable and passionate about his teaching. He takes attendance every lecture which ends up being a large chunk of your grade, so just show up and you'll get the credit. Two 4-page papers, midterm, final, and participation is all that's graded so there is little room for error. NOT an easy A, but doable if you try. Nice guy:)

Dr Rivers was a pretty good professor. His lectures were boring at times and sometimes he seems to talk about about the same things over and over again. Attendance is mandatory. The class is pretty easy, although you have to write two 4 page papers.

Okay so the lectures and class material itself is really boring but i've never really liked history anyways (took this as my GE). He does provide an interesting point of view though. This man is one of the most caring and accommodating professors i have EVER had. He will bend over backwards to make sure you have what you need to succeed.

Rivers, Daniel is a little moist I have to admit but over really stand up guy. Both him and his class are elkay. I think he's generally a solid and humid teacher. Overall, I would take the kings class it was easy.

He is the sweetest guy and all he wants is for you to pass. His lectures are boring, but theres practically no work for this class. 2 exams which are essays that are graded so easily, 3 discussion posts about readings, and 2 5-page papers. Those papers are annoying, but graded easy. He gives you the exam questions beforehand so you know the answers

Although he is very nice and clearly knowledgeable, this class is ridiculously hard for a GE. Each class is 1h 20 minute tangent without any actual notes. Half of your essays are graded by a TA--even though he seems like a good guy-- who has ridiculously high standards. This course is more difficult than 5000 level courses I've taken. Avoid!

He is so committed to making sure his students succeed. He is kind, knowledgeable, and committed to the students. NO TEXTBOOK REQUIRED. he posts all his readings online. Would recommend taking a class of his.

Dr. Rivers is great. I originally took his Native American History class and loved it so much that I took his LGBT History Class for fun. His classes do not require a textbook. Rather, he uses published articles that are available for free online. There is a LOT of reading! Lectures are fast-passed and very interesting.

Easy to pass the class-gives a set of short answer and essay response questions for the exam, then picks from that list for the actual exam. Lectures are a bit dull and there is a LOT of reading. However history is generally a dull subject (especially GEs) and he does a good job with it.

I took this for a GE and the lectures were very boring and the class required a lot of reading. The final grade was made up of 4 papers and an attendance grade. He is a fairly easy grader and as long as you put in at least a little effort, you will be fine. I don't necessarily recommend this class, but if you don't hate writing it is an easy A.
Great guy overall, cares about the topic he teaches and isn't that hard of a grader.
7 Papers for the semester. Uses lecture videos from COVID.

The lectures can be a bit dry, but Horger is understanding and helpful if you reach out. With some textbook readings and a few essays, it's an easy A as long as you put in the effort. unstuck study was a lifesaver for preparing the essays.

I took this class because I don't mind writing papers so none of the assignments were too big of a hassle for me. I never did the readings and just skimmed them when it came time to write the papers. Content was generally interesting I just listened to the lectures in 1.5x.

Great professor. I have taken Dr. Horger for two classes now. Similar format, graded on 6-8 papers. Anywhere from two paragraphs to 9 pages. Free 100 points just for turning in all assignments. Helpful lectures. Lots of reading, just skim to help write essays. Accessible outside of class. Topic is dull but he makes your research meaningful.

Professor Horger tends to spend a little too much time on his lectures and rarely provides time for questions to be asked during class. There are only four assignments that are graded: two essays, a final and a midterm. Beware that he does not just talk about sports the entire time.

Not a great lecturer, they are pre-recorded and are pretty dry, but he is very understanding and helpful if you email him. 5 short essays, a 5-8 page midterm, and a 6-9 page final essay make up your total grade. There is a lot of material to read and watch, but he isn't a super harsh grader. As long as you put in some effort, it's an easy A.

Professor Horger is a great lecturer who may lecture a little too much. The entirety of the class is him talking about more of the business and spectator aspect of sports, so if you think that you'll just be talking ball the whole time, you are wrong. There are 4 papers: a midterm, final, and two other essays. Grading criteria is strict.

For a history class, the content is pretty interesting. I took his class online and it consisted of 7 essays. 5 shorter papers, a term paper (5-8 pages) and a final paper (6-9 pages). The topics of each essay are pretty easy. He is not a super tough grader. Hard to get an A but hard to get below a B on papers. Not the worst class, but not the best.
Lectures are pretty dry and boring, attendance is mandatory as he makes you send him a code every class. Only 4 papers the whole semester which were pretty easy, just on the readings and lectures.

Horger's class is overall easy as it is just based on a few papers. The lectures are required but pretty useless as most of the essays are about the readings. If you put in a little effort it is very easy to get an A.

Class consists of 7 papers. Most of which are very short (a page or less) but the final two papers are each 5-8 pages. Dont take if you mind writing essays. As long as you understand the modules and apply his ideas to the papers, youll receive a good grade.

There are 7 papers total in the class (that's it). There are a lot of readings assigned per module. As long as you read at least one per module, you will be okay. As long as you watch the lectures and at least skim the readings, you will have enough essays. He is a fair grader. I would not recommend it if you don't like sports or essays.

Horgers lectures were utter useless as all the essays were based on readings only and the only thing graded the entire semester was 4 essays. The essays were also extremely long and there was soooooo many readings that were all extremely lengthy.

Professor Horger mandates lectures that benefit you in no way. He constantly tells you to draw information from the readings, not lectures. Even if you did use the lectures, you'd be at a loss because he constantly goes on tangents. He assigns absurdly long papers for an entry-level history class. His class takes too much time to be worth taking.

This course is overall very simple, only being graded on your papers. He grades fairly easy as long as you include the information asked and meet the length requirement. The course readings and slideshows are useful, but not required during the course and I even found it easier to just do overviews of each.

Honestly had some of my greatest and unique feedback in college from his class. Very laid back. Don't feel afraid to reach out for thoughts on a paper before submission. Also don't put off papers to the last minute and you'll enjoy this class.

Grade is based on 7 essays, the first few based off of one reading assignment, and they become more complex, with the term paper (5-8 pages) and final (6-9). A lot of reading, as long as you do most of it youll be fine. Lectures have helpful info for the papers. Not a tough grader but gives 1 comment. Dont procrastinate and youll survive

This class is ALLLLL about writing papers so if you don't like papers DO. NOT. TAKE. THIS. CLASS. Although the class itself was pretty easy and the content was easy to understand bc we just watched him lecture, your grade is based solely off of 6 or 7 papers.

There are a lot of books he has you buy read throughout the semester. He rambles about things that do not seem to make sense or have relevance. Be sure to take notes on what does seem to make sense and google what doesnt (or what wasn't covered). Only grades in this class is attendance and the exams. Must understand the exam prompt ahead of time

Feedback is frustrating; his responses come off very condescending and unsympathetic. Be sure to buy the books, but only skim them for the papers/tests, dont read everything; theyre boring! Only four grades in the class: two papers, midterm and final. VERY EASY GRADER. Lectures are boring. Take IN CLASS, NOT ONLINEHe said he makes online harder!
Not the most exciting class, lots of required reading that you dont have to do. You only need the books for the papers. He doesnt grade the papers hard, Exams are graded easy.

5th year history student here. I write papers. I like papers, especially on more bizarre topics. Why tell you this? Because this class made me hate writing. And papers. And history. And sports. And anything that happened in the 1800s. I was just trying to pad my grade before graduation with an easy online course. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.

One of the worst profs I've ever had. Took the online course so every assignment was just essays based on the online lectures and reading materials. When he grades he takes off points for reasons not relating to the actual argument you're trying to make. Also takes weeks to grade papers. Comments aren't constructive, just bashes on you. Got a B
Very dry Material, and engagement in class through papers is not exciting.

As a sports fan I was hoping this class would be more interesting than it was. Lectures are very detailed and lots of reading is assigned. All assignments are essays, and Horger is a tough grader with confusing feedback. Is a somewhat time consuming class, so wouldn't recommend for an easy GE.

He is a very smart guy but you get sooo much reading to do. There are impossible amounts of reading to do weekly if you are also taking other real classes. There are also around 10 papers to write throughout the semester that range up to 10 pages in length. There are much easier history classes to take if you are looking to fill your GE requirement

There are a total of 8 papers, in which all of them are EXTREMELY tedious to write. The given materials for the papers are several several pages long/from the 1800's so nearly impossible to read. Writing 6-8 pages on very specific themes is pretty difficult/ a total waste of time compared to taking a course that you can get an easy A in.

He expects a lot for a month long online class that is just a gen ed. There were so many papers with two of them being quite lengthy. It is not worth the work and I am planning on avoiding his classes in the future.

OK this is the only review you'll need for our friend Dr. Marc. Bottom line - take his class. I've taken two of his now and I have gotten an A in both. Go to lecture. Get the books but don't read them (only need to skim for quotes  2 papers not hard he is an easy grader. Take some notes during class and translate that on 2 written tests. EASY A
Very tough grader. He seems very knowledgeable, however, it can get boring. Beware of papers. For the online class, he posts his own lectures...

Super boring class, especially at 9 AM. Books are a must as you need them for difficult papers. He is a super nice guy and loves his own jokes, but your probably wont. Attendance is also key for the class. Two 5-8 page papers that are very painful.

He is not clear at all. The dreadful videos are so hard to follow. He seems as if he is trying to rush through it. He also kinda seems like he thinks you already know what he's talking about. His essay/term paper prompts are extremely vague. He will usually give you one topic, and you must write 5-8 pages on a single topic. Awful. I was miserable.

AVOID AT ALL COSTS. It is a terrible Gen Ed to take. Not worth the time at all, papers and readings will have you swamped. He's a good professor, but  gives way too much work and grades harder than any english or lit class I have taken

This is a terrible Gen Ed class to take. Two long papers (5-8 Pages) at the end that are not worth the Gen Ed requirement.  All of the other assignments (2-4 Page Papers) are graded extremely difficult.  If you do end up emailing him with a question, he responds quickly but that is the only positive I have.  Would not recommend to anyone.
Took this class as an online GE for my major. HUGE MISTAKE. Yes, he does know the material, but 2 5-8 page papers and numerous 2-4 page papers make this class not a good choice when it comes to GEs.

He is a good teacher. There is a midterm, final and two 5-7 page papers. You definetley need to get the books. Don't always need to read but books are essential for papers and exams. Exams are essay forms.

Online class taken as a GE. There were no exams at all, instead there were 8 papers (two 6-8 pg papers). He is a difficult grader and the class is treated like a senior level English course. If you don't like writing DO NOT take this course. However, if you like learning about the beginning of football, baseball, and boxing you may like the course.

Awful class to take at 8am. The whole class is just him rambling, and not including class in discussion. He knows the material, but doesn't teach very well. Powerpoint slides do not make sense when studying for exam, so TRY to take notes based off of his rambling lectures. Decent grader, but is really stiff on guidelines. Papers are tough. 5-7pgs
Awful. Just awful. Having to write TWO 6-8 page papers for an online GEC was ridiculous. Don't take this class.
Lectures were very boring! He did grade exams and paper very easy.  A lot of books required, but barely read them and still got an A.  He does know his information
Fair grader but lectures are terribly long, boring, and irrelevant. Way too much reading, had to buy 8 books and didn't read any.

Considering how boring the material is, he did a great job with getting the info across. Go to lecture!! He uses common metaphors throughout everything and refers back to them so you can understand everything as a whole by the end of the class. Read the textbook; he notices when you do and gives you better grades because of it. Nice guy.
Great professor

History of Sports was not what I thought it was going to be. However, you won't find a professor more knowledgeable in his field that Dr. Horger. His lectures consisted of him mostly talking. A large amount of reading was required for the class. Two papers and two exams made up the whole grade. He is a very fair grader and provides good study guide

Dr. Horger is a nice guy and always tries to keep lectures interesting. His lecture notes aren't all that helpful, however if you actually listen to him he explains things very well and I found it useful. Everything (midterm, paper, final) is graded by the TA though. Overall I did enjoy this class.

Tends to ramble.  His lectures are not useful.  If you want to learn the material, you just need to read the books.  And lecture does not even matter because your grade is determined entirely by the TA.  The TA grades the midterm, paper, and final.  I would try for another prof for Hist152
I had him for 398, and he was a very easy grader and took time out for every student. The no notes thing might have been tougher in a different class though.

This guy does no care about his students. No notes. I tried to email him with a simple question for a midterm paper and he responded with "Read the Book."...nothing nice to say about this guy...go in another direction.

I'm a sophomore with a 3.5 GPA and I felt pretty confident going into this class. I was wrong. Prof. Horger is an extremely intelligent man, but a horrendous professor, given this is a 100 level class. He rambles and DOES NOT GIVE ANY NOTES. I felt in the dark the entire quarter. I know others that are in 151 with different professors, AVOID HORGER

Great Professor! Lectures are fun, & clearly illuminate the concepts. Read the book, attend class. If you have questions, Dr. Horger will help you.  The TAs are also very helpful. Both Dr. H and TAs are well prepared. I learned alot in this class.

Chugs too much caffeine during lecture, and ramlbes too much. All around knowledgeable in his field, but goes off on too many tangents. I learned WAY more in our discussions with the TA. PRO: Tests were decent though, as long as you look over the study sheet, you'll be good to go. CON: WAY too much reading assigned.

Too much reading and your grade depends completely on your TA because it's all based on essays and papers. Horger likes to ramble, bash on conservatives, suck on suckers and throw his keys at his pointless slide shows. Two thumbs down. He should lay off the caffeine.
way too much reading.. had to buy four books, hard to follow.  very knowledgeable but bad at relaying it to students.  All essays for grades.
His exams are all essay based while other professors teaching the same class have multiple choice exams. I would not recommend this class.........EVER

Caffine fueled, extremely knowledgable about subject.  Fun lectures.  Grade depends on TA, mine was was intense & tough.  Wish he did a recitation tho, would have liked that better.  TA was too demanding and offered no extra credit.  Marc was great!
He likes to ramble and they makes it hard for taking notes. His powerpoints are of no use really, but they still help. I had an awesome TA which is why I got a B. She was super helpful.

horger's class is hard because its totally essay based. I pulled a C+ and got lucky. I have friends that went to every class and took really good notes and still did poorly. He also does not provide power points and you have to just write down wat he says which is often hard because he likes to ramble.

Hardest class I have taken so far BECAUSE your grade is in the hands of your TA.  The exams are all essay and really hard. I went to all lectures and recitations and got a C.  He expects you to write down everything he says and memorize it.

I would say take this class, I just took it Spring 2008 and I never went to lecture. Just go to the recitations and do the hw and you get a B. If you do attend lecture then you will prolly get an A. He has really dry humor and class was at 8:30 a.m. so I had no motivation to go. TWO THUMBS UP!!!!!!, TAKE THIS CLASS.
easiest class i've ever taken in my life. grade depends on ta. good gec-lectures aren't too bad, extremely easy subject.

He is an interesting guy to listen to.  If you want to learn about politics then go to lecture because that is all the guy talks about, otherwise it is not needed. The only history you learn is what your TA talks about or what you read, as Horger strictly talks politics.  The grade depends on your TA.  I got an A in the class without much effort.
did not learn anything for his lectures, stopped going after first couple of weeks. grade depnds on your TA!!!
This class is very easy. You don't need to go to class or read the books. I finished the paper without reading a page of the book it was on and got an A.

Don't go to lecture. I got an A in the class without going to lecture, just do the studyguide.  I didn't read the books for the paper either and got an 88 on it.  easy class i would definently take it

The grade you get truly depends on your TA. I hate history and managed to get an A because my TA liked the way I wrote. Apparently I did learn something from the class since I got an A! But honestly Horger is very ADD in class, running around a lot, but he knows what he's talking about and knows how to make it relevant to us. :)
I found his lectures surprisingly interesting. He made a boring subject pretty enjoyable to learn about. I would definately take another class taught by him if I could.

I took his class last year and he was easy to like. He did talk REALLY fast but he does make connections to modern stuff so you'll remember it. Grade does depend on TA. if your TA grades hard you're screwed. All you grades are based on essay midterms and a paper or two. The RTAP is a waste of money, so make a friend in the class and share it w them

Don't buy the RTAP. You won't use it and the book store won't take it back. I wish I would have listened to the comments on this page before buying the 57 dollar book. Don't go to lecture....it has nothing to do with the exams.

not that hard of a class. sure the grade depends on the TA because they grade papers/exams and such, but it actually mostly depends on you. SUCK UP PEOPLE when a TA is grading an essay he reads the name first. even if subconsciously, they will be an easier grader on you if they know your name and know you read and participate.
your grade depends entirely on your TA, you do not need to go to lecture....it does absolutely nothing for your grade....good luck on a good TA
your grade does depend on your TA.  Going to lecture and taking notes makes the tests a breeze.  Don't buy that RTAP book.  I never used it and got an A, just go to class and you're good!
this guy is addicted to coffee, but other than that not bad. he lectures off of power point the whole time, and tells decent stories. Also has a good sense of humor.

Your entire grade depends entirely on your TA. It is not necessary to attend class all of the time, as long as you study for the exams (use the textbook). Understand exactly what your TA is looking for and you'll do fine.
Lecture isn't necessary.  Your TA either makes or breaks your grade.
he's ok

If you like someone who is sarcastic and a bit edgy, this is the teacher for you. He likes to relate the class to current events but can stray from the topic at hand. Definately read and you should do fine. papers are graded by TA's so it really depends! Exams aren't impossible, but do take some studying to do well. Overall good class!

Lectures were BORING and strayed from what was relevent in the reading...a lot of info you really don't need to know for the exams. I really depended on my TA for instruction in this class. Keep up with the reading and his class is easy.
he's very arrogant and i found it very hard to like him.  also i had him in lecture 5x a week- don't do it!
No Comments

The class wasn't that bad, but he talks REALLY fast. You are constantly writing (that is, if you're trying to take notes on what he's talking about). It definitely depends on your recitation teacher though!!!! They grade everything, but the class really isn't that bad. Write everything you can think of on the exams.
Was very interested in teaching...related a lot of stuff to current situations. Tried to make history as exciting as it can be. The midterm wasn't TOO bad but the final was just insane!
Alright instructor just kind of boring. he trys to make class interesting by linking stuff to south park and the simpsons but it doesnt work.
HILARIOUS, intelligent, and makes lectures fun. Not fun if you are devoid of humor and life. Grade depends on TA though

He is very interested in history and shows it in class during lecture. He is not the best person to learn from for the tests but you learn other useful knowledge by going to lecture. If you get a good TA (the person who grades your very important paper) you will get a good grade.
All he did was show maps and complain about George Bush.

His powerpoint presentations were all over the place.  He went on random stories about his problems with different Presidents.  If I were to take the class again I would not go to class as it does not help you out as you are learning on your own anyways.
He's average
this guy is awful, you will learn everything you need to know from the TA NOT his lectures.
terrible. just plain terrible.

Horger is ok.  His lectures are very interesting.  His slides are mostly of maps.  He makes really funny faces, though.  The midterm was pretty easy for the amount of time I spent studying.  Go to lecture just because he sometimes does attendance.
The lectures are a waste of time.  However one of the recitation teaching assistants Lawrence Bowdish was great!!!!

GET OUT NOW! Lecture is a waste, you're only graded on papers&essays. He's obnoxious, makes no sense, & writes tiny on a chalk board expecting people to write down his ridiculous notes from across a lecture hall.
No Comments

If you want to see maps of stuff that will not help you at all then take this class.  Smart guy, but his tests are sort of ridiculus for the amount of time you get to take them.  The TAs grade inconsistantly, so maybe that it was why I had such a bad experience with it.
No Comments

I think that he is extremely interesting and full of energy for the class that he teaches. He does have a civil rights agenda to be gotten out of the class. Try to get a good TA and that will help immensely with the understanding of the class.

Aviod if possible. Really bad lecturer, i can tell he is interesting and smart but very unclear as a teacher.  He draws strange pictures to illustrate points. very bizarre.  But sometimes made funny simpsons/south park comments
Didn't even open the require texts for these classes and got an A- and A, respectively. Go to lecture, take notes. If you can write, it's a cakewalk.
horrible teacher get out while you can
SO BORING!! Avoid him.

lecture an absolute bore..75% of stuff u don't need to know. TA's do EVERYTHING and everything is in accordance to what they want, Horger has nothing to do w/ u except his rambling on in lecture. appears a harder class on the surface then it really is. just participate/listen in recitation & ur fine

marc horger is a nice guy when he's NOT teaching history. when he is teaching history he is boring as F*CK. i seriously wanted to take my own life. we wrote 2 papers and had an essay final. the TA's graded everything. i DON'T recommend him. he seriously has a cup of coffee every damn day.

Lecture was so boring and repetitive.  Long essay tests that you dont really know how it will be graded.  Had a horrible TA and was quizzed in recitation every week.  Just a bad class that was harder than it should have been.

Extremely knowledgable, places subjects in the greater global movements, slips in jabs at the right wing (if you ask, he'll definitely back it up), TA graded essay exams for content (largest part of class grade), as well as English proficiency. 7 page paper, small 1 page papers. Essay class=4days/wk

go to lecture. go to lecture. go to lecture.  TAKE NOTES.  That's the key to his essay version class because you'll have everything you need.  Very easy if you pay attention and take good notes.  He's a little hyper...and he does drop hints about his political agenda (very liberal) which is annoying

He does have a lot of energy. His lectures can be hard to follow because he gets ahead of himself and then forgets to return to his original thought. His knowledge of the material is unquestionable. Lectures are lively and informative. Test are reasonable. I do believe he is a socialist.

He was really unclear and I hated my TA.  I wouldn't recommend taking this class with Horger.  Take Hist 111 & 112 so that you get the diversity credit.  Don't waste your time with Horger.  He is like a rabbit on speed. He jumps around a lot!!!

He knows history well and teaches it well, but he has so much energy and talks so fast that it is sometimes hard to follow him.  He does do a GREAT job at making one of the most boring subjects interesting though
he believes that history 151 is the place to spout off his political beliefs.  he is wrong.
The class isn't that hard, but my grade only depended on my TA and my TA graded harshly.  Make sure you study and be ready for pop quizzes in recitation.

essay version is a breeze. very energetic but hard to follow. smart and intelligent guy. TAs are important. Exams will be fine if you follow the study guide, which is provided and discussed in rec. to make sure you know it front to back.

He's not the greatest of lecturers, but sometimes he tries to make it interesting. "This is to the degree you see this sort of thing" does get annoying though. But I had a good TA both quarters and came out with an A- and A respectively. No comp
not very clear at lecturing but is an interesting guy. CAFFEINE FEINE. take the essay version of the course and hope your TA is good.
exams are a breeze if you just follow his study guides.  Horger's intelligent and amusing but most of this is lost on his auditorium full of sleeping freshmen.

I've had him for 2 quarters, i suggest the essay version.  Lectures are pointless, he just rambles, don't even bother writing whats on the board.  And you need the custom textboob ($60) that you can't sell back.  Get a different teacher!
Sporadic. Annoying. Learned Little. Tests suck. Don't bother taking him.

Must learn how to take notes from what he says, not writes. I would recommend the essay version of the class considering the exam version is a lot more work. Also, the TA is the MOST important person in the class grade wise.
think SNL's Mr. Peepers meets That 70's Show's Red Foreman (for lack of hair)...and this is the degree to which you begin to see this sort of thing....take the class and you will understand this!!!

He was boring!  I enjoy history and he did not make history very enjoyable.  He does not communicate with his TA's, and your grade just depends on your TA, and last winter I had the WORST TA ever, so it just depends on you TA.  Lecture is pointless.
Very lively but lectures are very vague and broad and somewhat pointless. Follow the syllabus, attend recitation and rigously study for exams using the study guide provided and you'll be fine.
nice guy, lectures are pretty boring but he seems really to enjoy teaching.  Class is also pretty easy.  Good professor overall.
Good professor, knows material and even makes up a word or two every now and then to keep the class entertained.

Pretty funny guy.  I think he drank too much caffeine... couldn't stand still for a second!  Interesting lecture, but went on lots of tangents.  Make sure you read the book and go into lots of details and explanation in essays.
He talks too fast, goes on tangents a lot and pretty boring.  I learned very little in his class even though I went everyday.  His tests are tough...prepare to write fast and lots.
One of the worst teachers I have ever had. He is somewhat amusing but I learned very little from him, if anything at all.
tends to drone on in lecture, but generally an amusing guy. reading the book makes things more coherent
good guy, will bore you to death though.  not a lot of presentation.  funny guy though.  and check out his hair.
No Comments
I went to about 3 classes the whole quarter and got a B
Relatively easy class - ask him for bonus and he might comply.  Make sure you really explain and not just present material in your papers.  And for fun, count how many times he says  rectangular.
Great lectures, funny personable guy. Exams a little tougher than most.
Very impersonal.  Doesn't care about the individual student.  Doesn't help.
i hate history, but i liked this class
very good professor...learned a lot....very straight forward as well
Very entertaining class. Everything is in the book No need for notes just listen
a good teacher, knows is stuff. he tells funny stories, and has funny hair...
smart, witty, and intellectually stimulating

Dr. Hammack is a very sweet person but an inept professor. Her class lacks structure and is constantly nervous when presenting. she will give a 5 slide presentation and proceed to ask us for questions for around 25 minutes. she managed to pack the 4 1000+ word essays into the span of 5 weeks instead of spacing them properly but graded them easy.

I definitely recommend history 2015 if you're interested in the criminal justice system or something closely related. He LOVES what he teaches and I enjoyed his lectures,content is very interesting however he does get off topic quite easily at times.A LOT of reading some are very interesting others not so much,very lenient grader, random attendance

Professor Roth is truly one of the best at OSU. There is lots of reading so make sure to do it. The research paper, midterm, discussion posts, and final are graded somewhat tough as he usually looks for specific things, but his feedback is good. He always gives quiz/exam questions beforehand and quizzes are an easy 100%. Random attendance at times.

Professor Roth is one of the best teachers at OSU, he cares about his students and wants you to get the best grade you can. Quiz questions are given to you before you take them and they are over required readings, lots of reading in this class. He grades tough on essays and discussion posts but gives good feedback, just put in the effort.

Professor Roth is a legend. He is so incredibly intelligent and well versed on history, making him very inspirational. He makes his students feel valued and truly cares. This course had some assignments but focused mostly on writing a single 20-25pg paper.

Professor Roth is a King. He cares so much for his students and it really shows. There is lots of reading in this class which is the only negative but honestly it pays off when writing the 3 essays required in this class. I highly recommend this class to anyone who needs it as a GE. Very low stress.
Lectures are dense but pretty simple and easy, and answers every question you send him. Absolute legend in my opinion

Dr. Roth is highly invested in the content he teaches. It clearly interests him to no end, but it's easy to get him off on a tangent. For a GE course, there was way too much work: 2 film analyses (2-2.5 hr long per film), 80-120 pgs/week of reading, midterm, and final. Don't bother attending recitation unless there's a quiz (announced beforehand)

Used the Overfield textbook, but never even opened the Findley and Rothney textbook. Takes random attendance, but if you skip a class or don't pay attention AT ALL in class you're still fine. Really good GE class for an easy A. Great professor!

Took this class as a gen ed, and it is the worst class I've ever taken. He doesn't teach the material, just reviews 100+ pages per week you have to read out of the 4 books you have to buy. I would not recommend this class to anyone under any circumstances. He gets an F in my book

Ridiculous amount of information for one class. However, I really respect Dr. Roth, he is really caring. (My TA graded rather harshly though.) Recitation is the important thing, and reading is essential, or else you'll fail. Gained a lot of great knowledge about history outside of the U.S. and Europe, which is refreshing, so I learned a lot.

Professor Roth cares dearly for his students. He reminded me more of a grandpa due to being personable, empathetic, and wanting to make sure his students succeed. Easy to talk to outside of class, but the midterm and final are very difficult and require preparation. He gives you the questions two weeks beforehand, so use all the time that is given.

This class was way too intense for a GE. There was SO much reading. Roth was nice enough and lectures were okay, but if youre not super dedicated I wouldnt recommend. He also doesnt post any grades on Carmen. (He did send an email after the semester saying that he would change things and lessen readings but who knows)

Professor Roth is an amazing professor, but this class is a lot of work (specifically reading) for a GE. I would highly recommend if you are motivated to learn about the history of criminal justice in the United States, but it won't be an 'easy A'. He gives amazing and interesting lectures, and is a fair grader. Show improvement, get a good grade!

Just avoid. This is the most ridiculous class I've taken during all of undergrad. He's a nice guy, but he is just expecting too much from one class. 3 papers, 2 films, weekly quizzes over 200-300 pages of reading, midterm and final that require you to cite sources directly without having the sources with you. He is just trying to do too much. Don't

This is the worst class I have ever taken in my time at Ohio State. Do not take any classes with him whatsoever. He expects you to have PhD level knowledge, three papers, weekly reading quizzes over 200-300 pages a week, and you have to write essays for the midterm and final and cite specific evidence without having the sources with you.

Roth is an old dude, but still active. He assigns a TON of reading and expects you to remember details from all of it. I took this class as a GE and it ended up being very difficult. If you're not actually interested in the topic and just need to fulfill a GE, don't take him.

He is very nice and a good guy, but the lectures were dry as a bone, and the exams (the final, at least) were source heavy. You had to reference sources from the book without having the book.  Few quizzes that he warns you about, they are pretty easy.  You must read the sources for this class, or know people who are willing to tell you about them.

He knows everything you could think to ask about, which is cool but sometimes gets him off track. Lectures are a tad boring but not terrible. He gives major hints as to what he wants to see on the midterm/final in class, so it's worth going I think (plus semi-mandatory attendance).

Roth is an amazing guy! I cannot stress how much he cares about his students. He gives you the exact questions that are going to be on every quiz, midterm, and the final. He's a genius - he can recall all of the material off the top of his head. He assigns so much reading and it's a lot of memorizing but it's worth it to have him as a professor!

If you don't like reading don't take this class. He's a great professor and really cares about his students but the amount of reading he requires for his class is ridiculous. I do enjoy hearing his stories, Dr. Roth is awesome!!

A super awesome professor! Absolutely loved this class, always had a good time. His stories are fun to hear, and he made learning to write papers interesting. Would absolutely take another class with Mr. Roth.

THE BEST PROFESSOR I HAVE HAD AT OSU. He is a true renaissance man. If you attend lectures (which I recommend or else preparing for exams will be a nightmare) you will come away feeling enlightened and equipped to think critically about historical events in a whole new way. It is a lot of reading but worth the work.

Prof. Roth is very accommodating with extensions for papers. The class I took had no tests, even though he technically should have sent them. Personally, I got away with not doing any readings, but you should at least skim them, and go into greater detail for the ones you'll be using for your papers.
Funny stories, flexible teaching, give him the chance and you'll enjoy the lecture
An awesome guy, extremely helpful and always willing to give his advice and aid

Such an amazing professor and person! He is such a wealth of knowledge, the man literally knows everything. Possibly the best professor I've had at OSU. The readings are long but you can usually read the first half and skim the rest, his lectures go over everything.
He is my all time favorite professor

Dr. Roth is an excellent professor. He is such a pleasant man, very knowledgeable, and so friendly. If you take the time to meet and talk with him, he is more than happy to help you. The class was not easy, but I would recommend it.

One of the NICEST professors I have EVER had. He sincerely cares about the success of his students. If you engage in the lectures, and really try to get something out of the class, it is a great course to take. Lectures can get a little off topic, but definitely recommend this professor.

One of the best profs I've had at OSU. Important to keep up with the readings, but typically they were very interesting. Kind, patient, knowledgeable and passionate; holds review sessions before exams. Cares more about IMPROVEMENT than anything - if you get a bad grade on the midterm but improve on the final, you'll get a good grade! Dr. Roth = A+!

Dr. Roth was the best prof. I've had at tOSU. He has such a pleasant disposition and is always willing to help you, no matter your issue. The man knows so much about history that it is ridiculous. Also, the class is easy if you do the reading.

Awesome teacher!  He is really funny, super passionate about his topic, and very helpful in understanding material. He assigns a pretty good bit of reading, and the only reason his assignments are difficult is because they're all written assignments and essay exams.  But he gives you a guideline before every quiz/exam, so it's not too bad.
Amazing teacher, he is very passionate about what he teaches, and is always available for questions, and always offering help. Overall very well recommended
Nicest guy ever. He assigns a lot of reading - a lot - so be prepared for that, but all his stories and his passion for teaching history make the class so worthwhile. Just a really great teacher.

Best history Prof I ever had.  The guy is great.  Challenging, interesting, great lectures!  Learned a lot!  He really knows his subject matter and presents it in a clear and interesting way.  And by the way - I am married to a Professor myself, so I know good Profs when I see them....

He is a really nice guy and generally really interested in what he's teaching. He's super helpful at his office hours. But this class was ALOT of work for a GEC and a ton of reading. SO if you're looking for an easy history this is definitely not it.

Best Professor at OSU. Very helpful, kind, and LOVES teaching. He expects alot but is also very fair. You will become a better student just from taking his class, but don't take it if you don't want to do the work.
Wonderful professor! I enjoyed his class a great deal, and, even though it was a lot of reading and he's a tough grader, it was worth it. I would recommend any history class he was teaching!
Great class. He loves teaching and shows it. The material is interesting and so is the research and paper topics. Very willing to help. Do the reading and show up for class and it is a cake walk

Prof Roth is an excellent teacher. However, if you don't like to read you will find class with him VERY challenging. He is one of the professors raising the standards at OSU. His class was not easy....but you will learn!

enjoys teaching and lots of interesting stories. always goes a few minutes over, but its not too bad. a ton of reading and you need to keep up to pass the class except for the actual text book. the quizes are just summarizing and as long as you prepare answers for final and midterm you should be fine. he always has extra office hours to help

Good class, he LOVES teaching and wants everyone to learn. You can tell he is passionate about what he is teaching. Reading is 200+ pages a week though. He gives you extra time on the research assignment and paper if you need it though. Great teacher, somewhat difficult in grading.

This class had a lot of reading and a paper that required a LOT of time researching in old newspapers, but he actually made me really interested in it.  He's obviously extremely knoledgeable about the subject and really loves it, but he's completely approachable as well.
Brilliant person with a passion for teaching. A lot of reading for the class.

Professor Roth is the best teacher here at OSU ! Aside from being a scholar in his field, he is a kind person and LOVES HIS JOB AND SUBJECT MATTER. This shows in everything he does. The class and lectures were interesting and focuesd alot on discussion.  He makes every effort in office hours and review sessions to prepare all the students. A++

Focused a lot on writing - I'd get papers back that said: "Style/Org. - B, Everything Else - A" but I feel like I improved, and he was fair about it and really willing to help in office hours.  Wonderful class - only due to him am I interested in American history again.
It's obvious that he knows what he's talking about, and illustrates this passion through his lectures.  Keep up on the reading and you'll be fine.
fun lectures with lots of stories and stuff about culture, much more than just a political histroy he put his notes on-line. always there for students with extra hours before exams recommended

Roth is a good guy, he really knows what he's talking about and likes the material he teaches, but his reading assignments are all over the place and it's hard to know what's going on most of the time.
Very bright, very challenging. A stickler about writing style--to his credit, as a result I am a better writer. His critques are thorough and helpful.
Great teacher.  Kept the class light and fun, despite somewhat stuffy material, and was very easy-going grade wise.  Show up and do the readings and you'll do fine in this class.
The finest intellectual on staff.  Average students have trouble following...
extremely brilliant and very helpful, but really pushes you on papers
I really love this professor. She has high expectations to her students but also very supportive.

Professor Zhang seemed to care about her students and was willing to work with you, but everything was graded too hard for what the class actually was. Professor Zhang and her TA took points off of nearly every assignment for missing obscure details. Assignments were not explained well and were very confusing.

While she is a great person, I wouldnt take her classes again. The grading is super hard and there are a ton of readings. The assignments themselves are only out of 5 or 10 points each. I think the highest point assignment is the final group project for 15 points. Also the prompts for assignments are sometimes vague or hard to understand.

Her class for a GE can be strenuous, however she is an amazing professor. She truly cares to help you learn the material. I took a premodern east Asia history class and it felt like a lot at times but if you talk to here she help.

An almost absurd amount of readings were assigned, many of which were barely discussed. The class overall seemed very disorganized. While Prof. Zhang did seem to want to help, she also seemed like she didn't know what to do in order to organize the class format. Assignments take a lot of time and effort and are worth very little points.
I loved her as a professor so much! She genuinely cares for students and loves teaching. Lectures were so interesting and fun.
TO MUCH to read, and some are useless . TO MUCH to do for a GE class. She is trying to help, but I dont think this course is well-organized. So sometimes its confusing.

I took her class at summer session. There were lots of reading for discussion, but I didn't think she was particular about the discussion answer as long as you did the reading. All the quiz and exams were posted ahead online, and she gave students enough time to prepare. She was very willing to help, and she did care about students' success.

I took 2401 in a 4wk summer class and it was A LOT of work.  Like easily 8hrs a week of work.  I did learn a fair bit, and the quizzes were written responses to that weeks material, which was nice as opposed to just memorizing names and dates.  Her recorded lectures sometimes cut out, but generally there were easy to understand.

Prof Zhang is an amazing teacher. I have taken two classes with her and I found myself struggling in one. At this point Prof Zhang and I made a weekly meeting schedule and she helped me by reading multiple drafts of my essays. She only wants the best for her students but this is not a class to slack off in. Overall shes amazing.

Professor Zhang did a wonderful job of fleshing out early modern Chinese history.  She brought such a wide range of topics into the class.  No tests, all papers and short writing, but Professor Zhang was extremely helpful selecting topics, and was willing to read and critique multiple drafts.

The main thing about this class that irritated me was sometimes I felt the lesson plans weren't thought out. Some of the reading, I felt, was useless. Nonetheless, it was an interesting class to take. Fullfills the social diversity req.. Though I did go to her one time for an explanation on confucianism. "It is all around us" = response....
did not make you buy a text book.
One of the best professors I have ever had. Challenging but encouraging. Don't take her if you are afraid of doing a lot of work.
Expects too much out of any online course.

Had to drop this course after the first two weeks, The Reading consists of 50 pages per week, and the Lectures: are almost 5 hours long, expect you to write at least a 5-page paper every week, not really helpful regarding issues with YouTube playlists. don't take this class with other classes, take this class by itself if you want to succeed.
Good professor. Very knowledgeable. Easy class if you put in good effort, just a good amount of writing. Material is kinda boring and really long, but pretty easy A

The amount of reading for this class was insane, not to mention the videos which added up to hours worth of material. The lectures were also super long. The research paper was easy enough and the quizzes were not too bad if you read and watched the videos but you need multiple hours to dedicate to reading, watching videos, and watching lectures.
