Dr. Douglas does is passionate about what she teaches but assigns absurd amounts of weekly readings and videos. It would take hours upon hours just to read everything she says you're supposed to for the class. She has a TA and only has to grade 3 discussion posts and one final paper yet she hasn't graded the discussion posts yet.

Great prof. Made online lectures interesting. Fair quizzes. Paper for final. Tri-weekly discussions, which were time consuming and kind of annoying, but tolerable given that they were only tri-weekly. Class counts for two GEs, so I'd definitely recommend it! Also lots of extra credit points available.

Dr. Douglas is super nice and understanding if you need any help, extensions, etc. Her online classes seem to mostly be just an hour long lecture then a quiz every week. Every once in a while there's a discussion post which can be a little harder, but it's not bad. It's a very manageable workload!

First few weeks are MUCH harder than the rest. After that 3rd week, the workload (textbook readings) lightens significantly. Graded based on weekly quizzes and biweekly discussion boards; easy and accessible extra credit as well. Great and informative class to take, imo.

I took her class over the summer, and while I didn't do the best, she was very understanding when I asked. The course has a YouTube playlist each week of the lectures, along with an assigned section of the textbook (which is a pdf through Carmen). The lectures are long, anywhere from an hour to 4 hours. Space out your watch time to make it easier.

Professor Douglas was overall great, this was a 6 week condensed course, so lectures were extremely long, 4 hours, not taking into account additional videos or the reading material. During a normal academic term the work load would be manageable. Make sure you complete every assignment as missing 1 forum post can take you from an A to a low B.

Time-consuming class but Dr. Douglas is passionate about what she teaches and helps you learn a lot of interesting things. Follow her assignment guidelines and you will do fine. Readings are long but you can just read enough to get an idea and then skim for supporting info. If you have issues just email her and she's always happy to help you.

Professor Douglas is one of the best lecturers I have ever had. Lectures are long (1 1/2-3 hrs.), but they are interesting and she conveys the material very clearly. The only thing to watch out for, other than the lecture length, is that she will set due dates for papers on Saturday nights. Regardess,l if you have the chance, take this class.

Very very unclear grading criteria and probably the toughest grader Ive ever had in my 2 years in college thus far. If you see this class I HIGHLY recommend avoiding it if youre looking for an easy quarter class!!!

Dr. Douglas did a fine job teaching the content, however bulky it was. The main fault with her grading is that it is dogmatic. She establishes clear rules for what good writing is, and, upon a violation of her Bible of writing, she psychoanalyzes the cause of why you write differently. Maybe historians have the illusion of objectivity? Not sure.

This was the easiest class I've taken through 2 years. One quiz every week and 5 papers that were only 500 words. We also had the opportunity to fill out a 2 minute survey about ourselves and get 10 bonus points. Very easy class.

4 week summer course, 750-word+ discussion, three comments, and a quiz every week, quiz has two attempts but only shows you the ones you got right after the first attempt so do well the first time, easy A if you can keep up

Dr. Douglas is very passionate about what she does and I actually learned a lot from her class. Wrote like 6 papers and had weekly quizzes but they were not that hard, just be good at thinking broadly about topics. She was flexible with me when I had a deadline issue and you can tell that she enjoys what she teaches about. She's cool!

If you need a history credit, take history 1212. the easiest class i have ever taken. a quiz a week (with 2 tries and it shows you the ones you got wrong) and a discussion post as the "tests" which are also easy if you watch lectures and find some quotes from the book. so so so easy could not recommend it enough. you can also learn a thing or two

I took this over the summer. 2 discussions 4 quizzes. You need the book to find the answers for the quizzes but I didn't actually read assigned chapters. 65 points available for extra credit. Two chances to take the quizzes. If you want an easy A pick this class.

Prof Douglas is great. History is far from my favorite subject, and I only took 1212 to fulfill a history GE, but I am glad I took it with her. She is extremely understanding if something happens, and the criteria for grading in this class is clear. She works with students to help them learn and achieve. I would take more classes with her! Easy A.
Clear expectations, weekly assignments, lots of extra credit available. The workload was pretty typical for an online class so it was an easy way to take care of a GE.

Typical week consists of watching videos, reading excerpts from a text, then writing a discussion post. These aren't very difficult, but they can be time consuming. There's also a book dissection at the end of the course, so beware of that

This is the second class I've taken with Prof. Douglas and I would definitely take more. Interesting topic and I really liked the way that the course was laid out. Mostly discussion board based. Gave us the week off for Thanksgiving. Very understanding when I turned in a paper 30 min late due to a computer issue.

Super nice professor and a very straight-forward class. We had a discussion post every week, a break for thanksgiving, and book dissections to write on the 4th and 8th week of class. Very easy and goes by super quickly. I hate history but I loved this class and actually learned a lot. Very willing to help too.

Readings and Videos for course are excellent. TA's grade tough, but fair. The whole course is a great lesson on how to read information and articulate what you learned. If you work hard you'll do fine.
I'm not a history buff but everything was easy to understand
Way too much work for a second-session online class

This class was a lot of work in 6 weeks, but I feel like I learned a lot. There were papers on two (complete) books along with weekly reading and writing, so if you don't like a lot of reading and/or writing, Prof Douglas is not for you. Along with the readings, she includes video playlists to take the place of a lecture, which I liked.

Not enough room to explain. Far too much work for a 3k level class. 5 papers (5-7 pages) based on 400-700 page books that you have three weeks to read and write. On top of reading for these, readings are assigned weekly for discussion. Discussion 600 words and you better cite everything or she will report you. I beg you to take someone else.
Fair criteria and interesting topic
Be prepared to work because online classes are tough. That said, the prof was nice and helpful when I had question, the class was interesting, and I learned a lot. A solid class overall.

The class was a second session course, so she expected to get two weeks of material done in one week. While doing this you are expected to spend a majority of your week, reading and writing for her. Her TAs are also the harshest graders Ive ever had.
It's an online class so there's lots of work but I enjoyed it overall. It's different than an in-class course but I learned a lot and I would take a class with her again.
Way too much work for the course level. Tough graders (her and TAs.) Weekly discussion posts are extremely formal- never had a professor take discussion posts so seriously.

There is a ton of work in this class but Ive learned a lot and the prof is very helpful. Ive had family issues this semester and shes been more than willing to help me out and give extensions if I need them. Any mention of her being too hard is exaggerated and unfair, honestly. Id take her classes again any time.

very passionate about the subjects she teaches, learned a lot from her, little bit arrogant when it comes to knowing facts or when people question something she said, but she's nice enough. gave us 20 bonus points on a test for voting in the election, so that helps. not many hw assignments, so gotta do well on exams, all essay exams.

She's great. Loved her class. I hear people complain about workload but I really didn't find it bad at all. I also felt like I learned more from this class given the amount of work I did, compared to any other History class I've taken. If you have the choice, take Dr. Douglas.

Her class has 5 book dissections/reports, heavy reading, discussion boards with foot citations. Very tough grader. Not an easy A at all. Even if you think you're working hard, you have to work harder. Power points are nothing but her just speaking.

Took class online as an 8/10 week course. SO MUCH READING. Entire semester's worth of work in half the time. Professor is nice and communicates well. My advice: skim through weekly textbook readings (especially beginning and ending of chapters) and research topic independently and then write response--saves SO much time--TAs grade easy.

Dr. Douglas is one of the best. She clearly conveys expectations, the deadlines are clear, and her lectures are fantastic. She knows what she is talking about and I personally enjoyed her fun fact type stories she included. She will go out of her way to help you,but she is NOT a pushover. Don't mistake her kindness for an easy A, you must work.

Super helpful professor. Definitely need to attend lectures if you don't have the textbook, because her lectures are all notes and the powerpoints only have pictures on them. Willing to work with you and really, really kind if you pay attention and participate.

Great great professor. She teaches a bunch of different history classes at osu but I had her for 3500. She makes lecture interesting. Biggest tips would be to show up and do some course readings. Her teaching style is powerpoints that go with lecture, lots of neat history thrown in with lecture too on the side. Be willing to work and you're fine
She's great.  She understands how to relate what could easily be boring material to students.  I enjoyed her class.

Easy to work with.  Do the Carmen readings and show up to lecture (attendance is graded and her powerpoints don't have any words on them, just pics). Don't buy the book. She's really knowledgeable and nice, although a bit intimidating the first week or two.

Without a shadow of a doubt the best possible history teacher, I have had in my career as a student. Enthusiastic, caring, and most importantly smart, this teacher encompasses every quality of a perfect teacher. Despite a rigorous work load, this teacher manages to help every student individually to create the best versions od themselves. 10/10
God tier teacher
Worst teacher ever

He is always overly-excited about coming to class and teaching. Blasts music beforehand. Some heavy reading in the upper level courses, but as others have said, he makes it all clear and easy. Take him.

His classes were usually interesting. He is always excited to teach which makes you come to his classes. He also gives out the study guide-just review them, you'll do fine on his exams. There were quizzes and a paper...very manageable.
Absolutely incredible.

This was his first time teaching 152 but taught it well. He was easy to understand and interesting, unlike many other history profs. You can tell he loves history and even if you don't like the subject, he still makes the class bearable.

He was THE best history teacher I have ever had! I was pleasantly surprised by his lecture methods and he made every class worth coming to, by his stories and ways of teaching.  I highly recomend him!

Matt was a fantastic teacher! Go to class and write down everything he says and you will do great in the class. There is some reading, but he talks about it class so you always understand it. He is really excited about history, and wants to help all the students. Class and office hours were helpful, and never boring.

Awesome Professor!!! Teaches subject matter you've been learning since 2nd grade but manages to keep the class interesting! He's truly passionate about what he's teaching which helps you stay awake during the hour and 48 min lecture!  I definitely recommend him! Thanks matt!
Outstanding instructor - highly recommended!  Helps in out anyway he can...shame there's not more like him at OSU!  Cheer's Matt :-)
Great teacher... makes a fairly dull subject interesting. Office hours are extremely helpful. Fair grader, not an easy A but simple to get a good grade if you put the time in.
One of the most interesting guys. You can tell he actually cares about and is very interedted in what he is teaching. Not boring at all..overall chill guy. Recommend.
Best teacher I've ever had. You can tell he loves what he does and academia hasn't yet sucked the life out of him! Great at making Puritan New England interesting. Highly recommend.

he is the most positive person ever. even with an incorrect answer he makes it seem like the person was right. grades papers kind of hard for a GEC but has a good review policy that should be taken advantage of. good guy and a good teacher, and has a very very broad taste of music that he will talk about in class. p.s. he WILL be late to class.

He is extremely friendly and helpful- try and get him as your TA! He loves History and it sounds corny but it makes you (as uninterested as you may be about the subject) like it more, too. He understands that not everyone is a history major and is SO helpful and lenient when grading. One of the only GECs I didn't mind going to. 100% recommended!
He is the best will help with anything and is always available if needed
He was the best TA ever! so funny, helps you with whatever you need help with. he makes the quizzes and papers so easy! If you can, get Matt as your TA. me makes this class.
No Comments

AWESOME TA. He was a TA for Dr. Hegarty, and let me tell you, he made history bearable for those of us who hate history.  And he was WAY more than willing to help with papers, studying, questions, whatever.  Props to Matt.  He's awesome.

Only grades certain assignments for credit in Carmen, extremely hard grader! Be prepared to read every week and participation in class matters. Pop quizzes on readings and films almost every week with obscure questions that you must watch/ read the material to catch on. Nice, knowledgeable guy however.

Clay is one of the best professors I've had so far. His lectures are great and he provides a lecture guide paper to fill in if you so wish. His feedback on essays is amazing and I feel like he really helped me become a better writer, highly recommend taking a class with him your first year. On top of all this, he's just a great dude!

Clay is FANTASTIC and hands-down the best professor I have had at OSU so far. He is a tough grader, but also gives so much feedback and is happy to meet. There is also a lot of homework, but there wasn't a single reading or video that I thought wasn't necessary. He is also hilarious and I will never stop recommending taking a class with Clay.

He is a fantastic lecturer and he really cares about his students. He can be a very particular grader but I have never seen someone give as much feedback as him. He left me a full 10-minute audio recording breaking down my paper and explaining what was good and bad about it. Very available to talk outside of class and gets to know his students.

Clay was an awesome professor and this class was super interesting and I felt like I learned a lot. While the papers were graded tough, he gave clear and direct expectations and was more than willing to help you out at every step. Feedback was also individualized and helped. It developed me as a better writer. He is also hilarious.

This is my second class I've taken with Clay. He is one of the best professors in the history department in my opinion. If you are interested in urban or LGBTQ history, he is a great professor to learn from. Expect weekly writing practices, readings, group project, and at least two essays. He is a tough but fair grader and gives great feedback.

Clay is an amazing lecturer. He really cares about his students. But you must do the reading and homework and he moves really quickly. He is also a tough grader... idk anyone who got an A in my class.

Clay was an engaging professor who likes to crack jokes and obviously loves what he teaches. As other people have said, there's an insane amount of reading each week but he gives you the whole week to finish the readings. He's a really tough paper grader, and you'll most likely have to adjust your writing style to his expectations to get an A.

Clayton is definitely the best professor I've had during my time at OSU. The readings can be a bit much but are always interesting. He is a tough paper grader but gives excellent feedback and is always available outside of class if you need help or just want to chat. The discussions may seem intimidating but participation becomes easier over time.

Dr. Howard was one of the best I've had at OSU. He's very funny, super knowledgable, and lets his personality show through. There are discussions every Friday with a lot of assigned reading. There were three papers over the course of the semester, but no exams. He maybe graded the papers a little harder than other profs, but gave great feedback.

So the pros: Clay is very knowledgable on urban history, incorporates a variety of sources, humorous at times, and organized. Cons: very tough paper grader, takes a while to grade said papers, is very discussion heavy (likes to call out people), sarcastic, often interjects personal opinions as fact Class was reading heavy, understandably.
His class was ok, he's a really tough grader when it comes to papers. At least you'll get a good laugh in class.

Clay had been one of the best profs I've had at OSU so far. He engages the class in critical thinking and interesting discussions. The reading were awesome also. He is very funny and easy to talk to. He is a fair grader and supportive.

Would take another class with him. He is a great professor and makes the class very enjoyable. History is not my best class but I enjoyed taking this class with Clay. If you have the option of online or in class with Clay, take it with Clay. He really cares about this class and makes it interesting!!
Lots of readings but learned a lot from his class, participation in class is important, went to the University of Michigan but deep down knows that Ohio State is better
Lots of reading due every week. There were 3 papers that weren't bad. No tests. Clay is a great professor. I generally dislike history but actually enjoyed this class. Would definitely recommend.

I learned so much from this class, I think everyone should take it. That said, it's a whole lot of work each week for the Friday discussion class, and he grades pretty hard on essays (in my experience). He's an engaging lecturer, though, and I think everyone likes him.

Clayton Howard is the man. Every lecture was interesting, and Clay loves to answer questions, and constantly change the pace of the lecture to keep students engaged. My only complaint is there is a lot of reading for this class, which is a bummer, since I took it to fill a GE requirement. Bottom Line: World class lecturer, unnecessary work load
Clay Howard is an amazing Professor. One of the best that I've had so far at OSU. He's hilarious and actually knows how to teach. Would definitely take him again!
Prof Howard is great! It's a reading intensive class and it was a lot of work but I really enjoyed it and I would definitely take another class with him!

the teaching style is demeaning, constantly making broad belittling comments towards the whole class for not doing well on assignments. he expects everyone to master Chinese history before taking the class. expects so much from the students while not teaching. 4 books, one midterm, only have the take the final exam if you fail the midterm.

Proff Reed is someone that i have genuinely come to dislike. He is very rude to students and does not take criticism well. After failing almost the entire class on a MIDTERM paper he turned it into a lecture and scolded us when his lectures and class materials are irrelevant and teach you nothing. He expects you to know everything and doesnt teach

He was a good professor but was very strict to the point where he has it if you record or take any photos of his lecture you will get reported for academic misconduct. Also, do not miss any class or assignments sd he does not accept any excuse other than big emergencies with proof.
do not take. 0/10

He can be super condescending and picky. He is really just looking for you to write about what he wants to see and hear. He sometimes jumps to conclusions and never really explains how you get to that conclusion and is constantly picking points that fit his agenda in the class. not objective. and he goes bell to bell every lecture which is hard.
He's very very picky, ended up dropping the class because it was so ridiculous. I heard if you go to office hours he's more lenient but overall just a bad lecturer.
Loves to talk and help students out, will listen to anything you have to say and provide quality feedback.

Very knowledge about the subject material, but conveys the information in a way that students can understand. You can tell that he cares about his students not just learning the material but understanding the causes and effects. Overall, the best professor I've had at OSU.

You can tell Ian cares about teaching--he is knowledgeable and enthusiastic. He blended lecturing with photos, videos,  and interesting stories--I feel like I lived through the Russian Revolution. He encouraged discussion and went out of his way to help students. I wish I could take every history class with him.
For a 100 level GEC he graded papers and exams like a masters thesis.  Really boring class too, straight from power points.  If attendance wasn't apart of the grade I would have skipped every day,

Professor Akin was amazing! I took this course last year but it was very memorable. Professor Akin's lectures are long, but he makes them super entertaining and engaging. He's super knowledgeable and highlights a topics importance very well. Overall he's a great professor and I highly recommend!

Dr. Akin makes funny jokes and his lectures are entertaining yet educational, and he grades very fairly. There is a great deal of reading required for his class. Additionally, attendance is not mandatory, but it is crucial as he goes much more in-depth in his lectures than what is available in the slideshows.

In many ways, your experience in Dr. Akin's class will depend on how much effort you put in; if you do your readings and show up to class prepared to learn and discuss, this class could be your best yet. During my time at OSU, I've never had a professor challenge me as much as this class, with real effort rewarded in learning and in your grades.
Dr Akin was very compassionate, had a great sense of humor, the lectures were phenomenal, and he will help you in any way possible. Definitely recommend his classes.

Most compelling course I have ever taken. Also one of the heaviest workloads I have ever had, but Dr. Akin is extremely accommodating and helpful if you show effort/interest and work in good faith. He's a really solid prof all-around.

This was a pretty good class! Most assignments were easy to finish in one sitting, but most lectures were about 15 minutes long and each section had 3-5 lectures to watch. This was his online class, so it is most likely different from his in-person class. There were about 3 essays for the entire class, one being the final. All of which were easy.

Grading criteria is unclear. Lectures often don't relate to what you're graded on. 

Rambles. Snarky and often rude. My least favorite class so far.
The guy has a massive superiority complex.
By far the worst professor I've at Ohio State. Mocks and belittles students for asking questions. The tests and papers he gives are nearly impossible to pass. I heavily recommend not taking him.

Nightmarishly difficult grader who speaks with a constant aura of condescension. It's clear that he doesn't care about student success. If this wasn't bad enough, the assignments givens are far above what should is generally expected in a ~3000 class, and the rubric is non-existent.

Finished 3501 with a C.

Good luck getting an A. You'll need it.

Hitory3501 is great, would take it with Prof. Parrott. He is always there to help you and will do his best to make sure you succeed. Show up to lectures and talk in discussions, and ASK questions because he will answer them and help you actually learn. Would take another one of his classes. The negative reviews are his online section so, inperson >

Prof Parrott was very helpful throughout the course. It is clear that he wants his students to succeed greatly and he even offers a number of extra credits to help your grade out. He was honestly the best prof when it came to writing assignments too since he gives great advice and will recognize the effort you put in. Definitely a 10/10

I have fairly severe ADHD, which tends for me to speak fast and occasionally get caught up in what I'm saying. In this class, you have to be correct in everything you say to avoid embarrassment. I enjoyed the content material, and engaged in it to better learn, however I was in fear the whole class of messing up. He embarrasses you when wrong.

This is my first history course but there was just the vibe that if I said something wrong, he would judge me hardcore. Lots of reading that I didn't do but literally all your essays are based off the readings. Interesting course but just wish there wasn't tests lol.

Despite the less than stellar rep on this page, I really enjoyed this class. His lectures were concise and informative, and none of the homework was overly complicated or too long. This class is pretty comprehensive in terms of what you learn, so I would only take this class if you were genuinely interested in it. Good guy with unfair reviews.

Some of the reading assignments were way too long, especially considering this was taken as an accelerated course and we needed to do two weeks of work in one. He also expected us to learn more from the readings than we did from the lectures, as his lectures were very general and he wanted more specific discussion details than what he provided.
The class itself was intriguing, but he comes off as very full of himself. He assigns an impossible amount of reading and is a very tough grader. I like challenges but I would not take him again.

His lectures are great. You can clearly tell that he loves the subject but I swear to god. The little pop quizez that he gives and homework assignment are way too difficult for an undergrad class. Like it literally makes no sense go the little things to be so difficult. And he is not actually willing to help students at all even though he says so.

One of the worst classes I have had the displeasure of taking. Great lecturer and is clear that he is well informed on the content of the course but it is also clear he has no interest in the success of his students. Assignments were unnaturally difficult and there were no opportunities for improvements. DO NOT RECOMMEND ANY CLASS WITH HIM.
He's a good guy and an interesting lecturer. Reading quizzes were unnaturally hard and the TA's grading was horrible.
Definitely not easy for an intro course but I learned a lot in very little time. Markus had clear expectations and if you like history this is a good choice!

I'm a history major and this class has been my least favorite. Super tough grader with tough assignments. For an online summer class this was way too writing heavy with a crazy heavy grading scale and the quizzes have the worst questions.

I thought I would hate it since I study PE, but I actually really liked this class. Schoof does not mess around and is tough but also fair. I learned more than in most other classes I have taken in my 4 years at OSU.

Professor Schoof is a really good and fair professor. His grading criteria is tough, but he gives really good feedback, and if you listen to it, there's no doubt you'll do well in this course. I definitely wouldn't say this is an easy A GE course, but if you're willing to put in the time and effort, you can really get a lot out of this class!
I thought this was a great class! Marcus answers messages quickly and tries to make things exciting. My favorite was the discussions, especially about recent history!

The only good thing I have to say, is his feedback on discussion boards and essays is very helpful. His lectures are boring, he assigns 5+ terrible quality youtube videos each week along with the lecture. Also, his weekly quizzes have the worst multiple choice questions I have ever seen, would not recommend for your history GE.

As long as you take good notes on lectures and key ideas for readings, it's really not too bad. Had to learn the hard way that he is anal about citations so provide those and you will be fine. Learned a lot!

4-week intro history class granted it was 4 weeks so the workload was more jam-packed than a regular semester. Provided irrelevant readings and was not clear in what to pay intention to in said readings. Graded on 4 quizzes/4 discussions, midterm paper and final paper. All were toughly graded for intro course. Dont take if looking for easy course

Schoof's an amazing professor and provides in-depth feedback on discussions and papers. The class is completely asynchronous with weekly discussions and quizzes about that week's reading and lecture. It is vital that you read the assigned stuff since he requires citations in the discussion but that is the only real pain. Take notes on his lectures!

Markus has been awesome! When I was going through some difficulties, he was understanding and helped me understand how to write better. I am not a "history guy" but it was a great class even though it was too much reading for my taste ��

Prof. Schoof is one of my favorite instructors here at OSU. I am not a history major but he really made it on grow on me. Might minor in it one day! He can be tough but it gets easier over time since he gives great feedback on assignments. The audio of lectures can be muffled but you get used to it lol Really sweet guy!

At first, I was frustrated because I never got the discussion score I thought I deserved. But Schoof gave me individual feedback for each of my 12 discussion posts. In the end, I figured out how to write better and use sources and got As. Interesting class, even though I am not a big fan of history. Schoof is a tough but fair professor.

This was a really good course. We started in colonial times and covered pretty much all of Latin America in the 19th century and 20th century. I knew little beforehand but had no problem. And wow, I had no idea how much the US interfered in Latin America! Quizzes can be hard. Discussions were easy. Papers were fair but took much time. Good class

This online class initially took me by surprise. The workload felt a bit heavy. However, as you get in the flow of doing the discussions and readings it gets easier each week. Schoof will not give you an A on discussions for simply summarizing the readings. He wants you to engage with the material and form your own argument. Def learned a ton!

I really enjoyed this class with Dr. Schoof. If you do the readings and pay attention to his recordings, this course is really not too challenging. 13 quizzes and discussions, but he only counts the best 10. Two large essays. It is definitely more work then other intro classes but I feel like I have also learned so much about the 20th century.

Often posted the material late and used inconsistent quiz policies (able to take every quiz twice, could sometimes view which questions were missed). Weekly readings, weekly quizzes, 2 weekly discussion posts, 1 essay midterm, and 1 essay final. Required 3 textbooks, which is a little ridiculous for an introductory course. Answers emails quickly.

If you are thinking about taking his class for an easy GE, don't. This is easily the most difficult class I have taken here so far and I am a 4th year. If you do not know every detail given in his lectures you will do poorly on the quizzes. He does not give clear grading criteria and will take off points if you do not follow his unclear rules. RUN.

Professor Schoof is a great guy that has a passion for teaching. He is funny and tries to make boring lectures a little entertaining. Attendance is required and if you dont go to lectures quizzes and exams will be difficult. There were 4 quizzes, a midterm, analytical paper, and a final. Clear guidelines are set for the paper and exams.

This was one of the hardest classes I ever took. I learned a lot about our history but this was not an easy class. Mr. Schoof really pushes you to your limits. I am glad I took the class but this was not a simple class to get an A. Definitely recommend him but do not take the class if you are hoping for an easy grade, even though it's online!!

Markus is a good guy. There were five not-that-hard quizzes, a midterm, a paper, a final, and then a small participation grade (plus some extra credit sprinkled in). The exams are kind of difficult, but fair. I enjoyed the class and am actually taking another one with Markus in the fall. If you have the chance, I recommend taking him.
Nice guy. Made class fun and I learned a lot. More readings than I would like but overall interesting materials. Assignments require time but are very much doable. Would recommend.

Emailed him a week before class started telling him I needed to take his class to stay on track to graduate early, and he replied he wouldn't over enroll his ONLINE class. Eventually got in anyway, and was easiest A of my college career. Only multiple choice quizzes/final. Clearly recycled Q's/lectures. Don't expect him to help you get in his class

Very easy courses. As a 4-week session 3 course, Dr. Wood deleted final paper and discussion boards wisely, which makes the course very easy. After reading all papers and watching assigned videos, you will have a good grade! Very easy GE theme citizenship!
History 3014 is a very simple 4-week course. The only tasks are the online quizzes and exams. Choose it, and you will be very easy to complete GE theme citizenship.

Mr. Wood is a very kind professor. He set the course very simple. All grades are based on the online quizzes and exams, so if you take a look of his lecture recording, you will get a very easy A to complete GE theme citizenship!
friendly, clear grading criteria, not much work, straightforward

Very easy class for the GE credit. Minimal Work, just one big research paper, but you'll have plenty of time to do it. He's a nice guy, and my grade stayed at an A the entire semester. Definitely would choose this for an easy GE Theme credit.

Just a weird class in general. It was a second session semester class but all the lectures and quizzes still felt rushed. The midterm/final are just recycled quiz questions and you get the feeling this professor doesn't really put in any work into making this course. One big paper at the end which was harshly graded for no reason with no feedback.

Really chill online class. The professor was super helpful during online office hours and answering emails. The class does take up a bit of your time, but it is a very easy A as long as you put in any type of effort. Bi-weekly modules with reading tests and one paper that wasn't so bad. Highly recommend it as an elective history class.

I had Dr. Wood online so I wasn't really able to develop a relationship with him. His class was easy, 4 quizzes a week, but they were nothing hard. As long as you do the readings and watch the videos this class is an easy A. He also gives practice quizzes that are the same as the real quizzes so there's no reason not to pass this class.

I took as a session 2 class online. Every week, we had two modules consisting of a practice lecture exam, practice reading exam, lecture exam, and reading exam. You were able to take the practice exams as many times as needed to score 100%. There is a midterm, final exam, and final paper -- all not too bad. Would definitely take again!

Generous with deadlines which was great especially during the shift to this new online class format and he responds quickly to emails. Lots of lecture videos, they move a bit slow but they're recorded, quite a bit of reading as well. Had 3 major final assignments. The content is not difficult but the class moves through a lot of material quickly.

One of the worst profs I ever met. He had almost no interest in helping. His instructions were confusing and hard to understand esp for the paper and project. He gives too many lectures (16+ a week) and theyre difficult to watch. I watched them 2-3 times and didnt learn a thing. You can't use outside sources for the project when his sources suck.

This class is a lot of busy work. He is a fairly easy grader and seems to want the students to learn. That being said I do not think this course is really teaching anyone anything. He does not seem passionate about this course. I feel like having a final paper, final exam and a final project is a lot to push in the last week of the semester

I never liked history, but this class made me like it. Really well organized online class and great lectures from Professor Wood. Good and timely feedback. Clearly some students are bitter judging by some of the reviews, but I've talked to many classmates and I'm not alone in thinking he's awesome.

Group projects, , , in the middle of a pandemic? Doesnt sit right with me. Its not a lot of work and you dont get much interaction from him. Overall his weekly messages rubbed me the wrong way. Personally he felt out of touch with what was going on. Very very negative

Josh Wood is probably the laziest professor Ive had to deal with in my three years of being here. He gives you a final paper, a final project and a final exam at the end of the semester to complete. Any questions you have must go through the ta first. Dr. Wood doesnt teach, he has multiple errors in his quizzes and tests and hes got a huge ego.

Honestly confused on why his ratings are slow. Took his class online yes reading is required welcome to History courses duh! Easy to understand if you do the material assigned and your part promise you easy A. Plus he is very understanding and explains things in a easy interesting historical way. Loved this professor never even met him.
Great experience. Super easy.

Had a family emergency and missed the first 2 exams of the first session course. Dr. Wood did not hesitate to help. The videos are a bit slow, but he provides the lecture slides and responds very quickly to emails.

Class is really easy if you actually put the effort in. I watched the videos and took notes. Exams were really easy. Not the most exciting material but straight-forward. I'm glad he uses notes instead of rambling on like some professors. Expect to work for your grade. Emails were quickly answered and friendly.

i took this class during the second session in the fall semester. Graded on 3 exams. The exams do relate to the books which are THEEE most borring thing you have ever read. He then selects info out of them which you would see as minor. His lectures are extreamly horible-like he is reading from a script and reading like a 5 year old. DONT TAKE HIM!

The class was poorly organized and he does not respond to emails asking for further explanations or assistance. Focuses on unimportant details in a GE course. Uploads prerecorded videos and still can't seem to find the time to assist students. The test questions are worded poorly and don't follow basic English.

Class content is slides with one bullet point so you have to take notes as quickly as possible while he talks. Three mutliple choice exams, but he uses trick questions. The textbooks are three novels. Very frustrating class because no notes provided. I would happily listen to the lectures if he gave notes. Its too much for a low level class.

Three or four hour-long lectures a week, and he talks really slowly. Three exams based on the content before each exam, not cumulative. Three novels as textbooks. Tricky and detailed exam questions, multiple choice and T/F. For a low level class, its very boring and time consuming. Took it for fun and it was not enjoyable.

Did not like him very much at all.  Participation mattered way too much. He did say from the very beginning that it was part of our grade, which, is why I did participate, but I got 0 points for it and he neglected to tell us that those points were more difficult to obtain than on the tests.  Avoid him and his classes at all costs. Trust me.

He's tough but you can tell he really cares about his students and goes the extra mile to explain things to you personally if you don't understand. He's kinda funny too. I hate history but I liked his class a lot because he challenged me and made me rethink things I thought I knew. Participation was mandatory, but he made that clear from the start.

Josh is a good professor. I learned a lot from him and his class wasn't too bad considering the subject matter. The only complaint I have is that I got an A in his class but it went down to a B after he gave me 25/100 for participation even though I showed up to every single class, got there on time, and did all my work on time.
Nice and funny! If you go to class and do your best to read and pay attention then your grade will be good. I had a lot of questions before the midterm and final and he took time to help me.
Really interesting class. He cares about the material and cares that you actually understand it. However, that also means it isn't a cakewalk. You'll get out as much as you put in.
He's hard but that's because he cares about the subject. There's a lot of reading, but its interesting and important. You'll work hard, but it'll be worth it. Class discussions are really good.
Wood is the worst teacher I've ever had the misfortune to interact with! He is Extremely unhelpful and not care of your grade at all!
HORRIBLE

He was a great teacher! He cared about Greek history and teaching it well, but he also understood that we all have lives outside of school. It was very easy to manage my time each week as long as I planned ahead. If you do the assignments and watch the videos each week, you'll be fine. Also, the exams were take-home open note so that was super nice

The best online lectures I have ever had! Prof Anderson explains everything very well and shows immense knowledge and interest in the things he is teaching, which makes it easier to learn. If you love learning about history or you are a history major, make sure to take Professor Anderson!

very great professor and gives fantastic lectures. gives a fantastic insight into today's world through the lens of the ancient Greek world. This class does use textbooks, but there is only one that you have to buy only $13. He does provide printouts for the other two books. if you like this class, I would recommend that you take HIST 3211.

Although this semester is not finished, I can strongly say that Dr. Anderson has been the best teacher I have had in my short time at OSU. The class subjects may be boring to some people but he makes plenty of dry humor jokes to keep your interest. Classical Greece was my favorite class of Spring 2023. 

For my harry potter fans, think Remus Lupin.

Extremely friendly and lenient grader, just be sure to attend lecture because it is required (but very interesting courtesy of professor anderson). Only assignments are a final paper 30%, attendance 10%, mid and final 60%, which are easy as long as you pay attention.

Good at teaching. Lectures are sometimes interesting but can be dull. And this is from someone who is interested in the topic, so I know its not me. Giving him a 2/5 because he posts nothing online and refuses to accommodate. Was out with strep for a week and he said no to any accommodations, so if you think youll need some, do not take him.

Professor Anderson is probably my favorite professor I have ever had. I took his class during summer semester 2020 and I genuinely enjoyed every moments of it. He's extremely engaging, passionate, and it's clear he cares about his students.

Greg is a phenomenal Professor. He lectures in a very engaging and he really cares about students. Go to office hours and chat with him before class, hes a great professor. Would highly recommend this as a history course.

Truly one of my favorite professors I ever had from any of the three colleges/universities I went to. He's very passionate about what he teaches and takes a real genuine interest in his students. I was fortunate enough to have him twice and will absolutely miss his lectures, including the virtual ones because of Coronavirus.
Take good notes or you'll fail. Besides that the class was very interesting and entertaining. You'll learn a lot.
Hilarious, kind, and genuinely takes interest in the students. Take good notes while he lectures and you will get an A

I would take the other reviews with a grain of salt. Although Prof Anderson is a nice man his class involved boring lectures everyday with no focus, 2 exams and one paper that creates the final grade. This is strictly a class for those who are already interested in and knowledgeable about Greek history otherwise it is not an easy A for a GE.

One of my favorite professors at Ohio State. Really is passionate about Greek history and you can tell by the way he lectures. I'm a history major and this was probably one of the easiest history courses I've taken here. If you are looking for an easy history GE, this is definitely your guy!
2 tests and a paper for the entire class. If you show up to class (which is mandatory), and take decent notes you can walk out with an A and a nice, british friend.

Dr. Anderson is a wonderful prof. Who gives great lectures. He seems very passionate about his field and teaches it in a historicist way, that is looking at history on its own terms. He's one of the best profs I've had in hist. And is also pretty easy. I would recommend him to anyone.
His lecture are great. History isn't my strong suit but I really enjoyed his class. Nicest guy ever.

We had 2 tests and 2 papers to write. No homework, just readings that were enjoyable most of the time. If you show up, you will pass. His lectures are really easy to follow, and interesting! His tests are the most straight forward tests I have had at OSU. He has a dry humor that is actually pretty funny. Definitely my favorite professor!
So nice! Really passionate about Greek history and likes to talk to his students before class. Funny. Exams are so easy.

I'm an engineer and had to take a History GE. He is the SWEETEST guy ever, and as long as you take really good notes and study for the exams you will do fine. Warning though - the lectures can be very, very boring. He does not have any slides so you need to actually pay attention all class in order to get good notes.

Not a big history person but this class was excellent. He is an engaging lecturer and is very passionate about the subject. I would recommend taking notes on a laptop because he covers a lot of material in a short amount of time with no powerpoint slides. I loved this guy and would recommend him to anyone.

He's an adorable british guy who loves to teach about the Greeks! He's fun to listen to, easy to talk to, and as long as you take basic notes there's no reason you shouldn't get an A. His tests are straightforward and simple, and he gives extra credit questions!

Professor Anderson was a fantastic lecturer.  From day one he had us won over with his quaint British accent and concise lectures. He is a very articulate and fun individual, and while he shows his knowledge well, he keeps everything down to earth.  My only knock on him was he made the class TOO easy to get an A in.  Otherwise, he was great.

Greg Anderson is an awesome guy. He is funny, very intelligent, extremely articulate, and very down to earth. He is very understanding and easy to get along with. I highly recommend him. You will enjoy his class.
This was by far one of my favorite classes. I wasn't looking forward to taking 398 but he made it absolutely wonderful!

A great professor who really seems to know his stuff. Makes history a story, and apart from a few boring lectures he keeps the class consistently interesting. Midterm and final were very, very easy and straightforward, so as long as you put in a bit of effort the class is just a great experience.

I don't know, maybe I'm the only one that didn't really like his teaching style.  If you're NOT a verbal learner, do NOT take this class.  He doesn't give you any powerpoint slides and you are constantly writing everything he says down.  If you miss something, you're pretty much screwed.  I stressed myself out getting an A in this class.

The most brilliant professor I have ever taken. His teaching style is smooth. Tells a story of Greece, uses pictures, poetry, textbook. He is enthusiastic about the subject and helping any and all students succeed. Take his class, it is worth it.
He is excellent.  He makes everything perfectly clear and easy to remember.  He has a pleasant demeanor and truly tries to connect with each student - even in a class of 70 students.  Take his class.

He rocks! He was one of my few professors who seemed completely unintimidating. Classes were fun, relaxed and interesting, and exams were easy as long as you studied your notes. He seems to genuinely enjoy teaching, which is more than I can say for a lot of instructors. My only regret is that I didn't get to take 502 with him before I graduated!

He is fantastic! He teaches history as if it were a story, he makes it very exciting. He isn't out to trick you, he is very straightforward, which makes it easier to really enjoy the topic. He got me passionate about ancient Greek history which I knew nothing about before! Take him I highly recommend it.

Greg Anderson was by far the best teacher I have had at OSU. He is extremely knowledgable on a wide range of historical topics, goes out of his way to help students and has such a great passion for his field. He sticks to the syllabus and actively includes members of the class. I would change nothing about his teaching style. Take HIM!
Awesome guy. Easy class, he makes history as interesting as possible.  Very funny and would highly recommend.  Don't bother with the text.

He's an awesome professor! I wasn't that interested in Greek History before I took his class but now I love the subject! He is very hands on and loves debating different subjects in class. He's just awesome!
One word; Arete.

501.01 and 501.02 are probably the best classes I've taken at OSU and my major isn't even History.  He's really funny and really helpful and his midterms and finals are ridiculously easy if you show up and pay attention.  It's the only class I've actually read everything for and enjoyed reading everything.  Definitely take his classes!

Amazing prof, great accent, great sense of humor!  Extremely knowledgeable and very willing to help.  Tests are cake if you take good notes and study the passages well.  Even though the class was easy, it was definitely the most enjoyable and I feel like I've learned a lot, I still bring up topics from class in conversations today!
It is an easy class, and he is super nice, and funny

Great Professor, HIST 501.02. Awesome British accent. Very willing to help. Lectures were strictly notes, but tests and one paper were not difficult at all as long as you paid attention. Highly recommend ... get in the class early, as it fills up quickly.
he was awesome, my favorite teacher so far. if you take good notes you have the answers for the tests. he's super kewl

He was thoroughly interested in the subject matter he was teaching. Lectures were a delight to attend (class was always overflowing), and tests were reasonable if you took decent notes. Greek names were a little tough, but he seemed sympathetic in the grading. Did a nice job of comparing the past to the present and making it all seem worthwhile.
Was a fantastic teacher, had taken his brother for a few courses, and am positive Greg is the easier of the two... would recommend
best teacher at wsu! i've had him for about eight classes or so.
I loved taking his class.

Appears nice in class, but outside of class...whoa!  If he gets p.o. ed about something, he uses profanity, will completly put you down...he's got a mean side to him.  If however, he is always in a good mood for you, then he's one of the better profs on campus.

I know he's a classics professor, but this history class was fantastic. He's really helpful and is actually funny (unlike most history profs) - I recommend taking anything from him you possibly can, because he's a visiting professor and I don't know how long he'll be here.

Great professor.  He takes it a little too easily on his students (towards the end we altered the curriculum, because Pliny was too much of a challenge), but he pieces apart everything so you know absolutely the grammatical reasons for the Latin. Great professor; everyone should take Latin from him.
Very fun prof., have taken 3 of his courses.

DR. Anderson is a great professor.  He sees that every student understands the material, does not play favorites with the students and overall a very nice, well mannered, and professional. He wants you to learn the material and will bend over backwards to help you.  Great Prof.
Awesome teacher! Still my favorite after four years here. Helpful, funny...  British...

Prof. Anderson has to be my favorite teacher here!  He tries to make things as easy as possible for everyone and is willing to listen if you have any problems.  I suggest you come to every class but as long as you come to the class before the exam to get the review sheet you'll be fine. :) :P :@) :)
Very friendly prof, always willing to help.  Tests aren't that bad, as long as you go to class, study and take notes, you'll be fine.
I think he was a great professor! Loved his accent. His tests were extremely hard but he would always listen to you if you had problems.
Very good prof. and very nice. Always willing to help and the British accent and good looks aren't bad either.
British accent!!! You learn a lot from him, and he is great to learn from!!!

if you want a class where you'd feel like coming to a good movie twice a week (for free:-)) take him. very interesting, smart, good dose of british humor, tests are easy. Makes every individual in class feel confident about the material.
Just show up to class and get the Review sheet and you pass the class with at least a B.  and the accent makes the material interesting
Very helpful, makes jokes in class, approachable, cool British accent!
He teaches this class like once in a blue moon but he is such a good teacher easy you just have to show up to class.
English Accent!! Way cool. Very nice, very helpful. The tests are a little rough, but if you go to lecture you'll be fine. Great teacher.

It's Latin...what can you say? You translate it, he gives about 3 tests. The tests have two previously-seen passages, one to translate, one with questions about syntax. He's kinda funny, it's a light-hearted atmosphere.

I have now taken 3015 and 3016 with professor Stebenne. While his teaching style may not be for everyone, he is my favorite professor I have had during my time at Ohio State. Show up to class and you will get an A.

I've taken two courses from Professor Stebenne at Ohio State and he is easily my favorite professor. He is incredibly knowledgeable about his subjects and is genuinely interested in them. I look forward to his lectures every week, I wish all professors were as likable as he is.

This course was very lecture heavy and the overall grade was pretty much decided by the midterm, final and a book review. It isn't necessary really to finish every assigned book as long as you can understand the theme and ideas the book provides. Dr. Stebenne clearly cares about this period of history but lectures can be very boring at times.

Knowledgeable and gives great lectures. Honestly wouldn't have a complaint if it weren't for the fact that he doesn't put anything online. You literally don't know your grade until after finals. Your grade in the class is determined by a midterm, paper, and final, so there isn't much room for error which makes it extra anxiety-inducing.

Lowest grade I've ever gotten in a course but it's mostly my fault. As long as you don't miss class, plan ahead for midterm paper, and study the main themes Prof Stebenne lectures on, you will do fine. Class is only made up of 2 written response exams and 1 paper, so it is hard to get an A. But I learned a ton & his lectures are the absolute best.

I enjoyed Prof. Stebenne but for a history GE...I wouldn't recommend. It's an interesting class and he's very knowledgeable on many subjects, but it's not worth it. You're graded on a midterm, paper, final, and attendance. He doesn't use Carmen so you will have no idea how you're doing until it's too late. Left me wishing I took a different GE.

Prof. Stebenne really knows a ton about what he teaches, and often interjects with personal anecdotes that help to explain a topic better. Hes old fashioned in the way that he lectures but always seems to keep the class engaged- if you participate and put in the effort, youll enjoy the class and learn a ton too.
This guy is greAt
Get ready to participate.

I had Dr. Stebenne for my introductory class to history. He's a nice guy, pretty talkative. He will occasionally go over the class time. In my class he does a great job of facilitating discussion. We did a lot of writing in my class (6 papers over the semester) but he gives good feedback. He's very approachable as well. I would recommend him.

I like him a lot.  He's a fountain of knowledge and basically fires information at you for an hour and twenty minutes so be ready to write lots of notes.  As long as you take notes you'll be just fine.

He is one of the most knowledgeable and interesting professors I've ever had, and he is basically a living encyclopedia of modern American history. I'm a history major so I never found his lectures boring but others apparently do. Attendance is graded, but the grade is the percentage of days you attended, which is the fairest policy I've ever seen.

Tough to listen to. I was in the class with history majors and they were falling asleep as much as I was. Attendance counts but not for much, then there's only a paper and two exams. I didn't  pay much attention and got a B on the first midterm and on the paper. But not worth listening to him drone on. If you have another option, avoid him.

Professor Stebenne know his stuff. But it is all law, and incorporates it HEAVY into all of his classes (took others as well). He refuses to use Carmen, and his "updated powerpoint slides" are nothing. Very difficult to take notes. Avoid if possible.

He is hard but he is the best history professor I have ever had. If you are genuinely interested in history, take his class. His TA's are decent graders. He only has a paper and two examns. Study throughout the quarter and you will get an A. I had him for 565 and 566. Both awesome classes

Prof. Stebenne is one of the best History Professors at Ohio State. If you attend the lectures and don't surf the web while in class, you will be able to get an A. He doesn't really provide much of a study guide for exams besides ID's, but his syllabus lets you know what to expect and he'll tell you.  But don't take it if you want an easy A!

A great class and a great teacher if you want to go to law school! I learned so much about the Constitution and the Supreme Court from him. He also teaches at the law school so you know he knows what he's talking about. Great professor!

This class was fascinating! It's not a class you should take if you want to slack off- you have to do the reading and come to lecture. It can be a challenging course but the information he gives is pretty interesting and the exams can be quite fun. His background is in law so he often tells the class interesting tidbits about case law, etc.

Professor Stebenne is very smart and his class discussions are interesting.  For this class there's a lot of reading but you don't really have to do it...just skim.  The research paper is really in depth but he is not a hard grader and gives a lot of suggestions on your 1st draft.  Overall, great teacher.  Enjoys his job.

A great class for those interested in the Supreme Court and the law. I'm really confused by the ratings below because I found his lectures to be really interesting. If you're not interested in law, it could become boring I guess. He's a difficult, but fair grader - there were 2 take-home essay exams.
Difficult grader, difficult to get along with; has opaque standards for projects, and basically grades on the basis of how much he likes you.
Fair lecturer who presents all sides of the argument.  Very helpful in office hours and a genuinely nice guy.

Decent lectures, but impossible grader. I don't think Stebenne knows what he wants; I went to four office hours and asked tons of questions, did all the reading, and put in 2x as much effort as I have in any other class, but he was still unhelpful and gave me vague comments with low grades. If you can't make a great first impression, watch out.
Very boring and could never understand what he wanted.  I asked questions but he just confused me more!
A super boring lecture..ZZZZ but the class was easy. He has a law degree from Columbia. Not to shabby.

type of professor you have to get to know.if you make an effort beyond the classroom, esp. with emails than he is great.incredibly well-trained.best writing instructor i ever had. hes tough but he can teach you more about writing than anyone else in the department (except maybe boyle) get to know him and you'll be fine if u are smart. great mentor.

Last comment is completely untrue;went into Stebs several times for help and offered none whatsoever, just contradictory & vague instructions; very condescending and just not a good teacher; avoid if you can or if interested in American history and dont want someone who plays favs 24-7-365.

One of my favorite profs. I took many classes with him. He really knows his stuff, he's very moderate politically and very fair. He WILL help you write if you take the time. I'll admite he's monotone, but his message is important if you listen. Great preparation for law school.

Possibly the worst professor i've ever met. Well creditentialed, but the most painful lecture to listen to. Also the most horrible grader ever, gives no feedback, and plays favorites, usually to stupid kids. I ended up withrdawing from his class on the last possible day; he wasted my time and money.
Good at teaching historical writing.  Very interesting, has a lot of good ideas.
No Comments

This man is a weasel.He pretends to welcome questions, but if you go to his office hours he does everything he can to load the work off onto the TAs,who are mostly idiots anyway.Take it with another prof, if you can.

very boring teacher. class is extremely difficult to sit through. his tests/papers are really difficult, but he is willing to talk to you about them if you go to him. overall, its best to pick another prof.

Awful,terrible,worst-whatever you can say.Terrible prof,snobby,arrogant,extremely difficult grader,doesn't care about students or opinions.Worst mistake I ever made at OSU was taking his class-won't do it again.

The worst prof. I've ever had.  Unfair and super-critical of everything, unless he likes you there's no way you can ever meet his expectations.  Gave out an insane amount of work for a 300-level class.  Avoid if possible.
Avoid at all costs.  Very pompous, not helpful, and just not a pleasant experience.  Seems kind of jerky, too.

Very arrogant, downright pompous; "I'm the kind of historian who could wear a white labcoat"; unclear what he wants, then when you give it to him, he finds other things to take off points for, which in the last paper he said not to include.To be

While a very bright individual with an impressive CV, I would not suggest taking a class with him.  He has an odd grading style in which he gives you one grade for content and another for writing style and averages them.  He also plays favorites.
Very well informed and knowledgeable
Borrrrring!  Tests were average difficulty, but the lectures were horrible, he is monotone and mumbled  for 48 min.  He was VERY hard to hear.

"can everyone hear me"- Monotone, tests not hard if you studied All the material. He is very smart and well prepared for class, but a little boring, you have to like the material to pay attention. But still a good teacher and a nice guy.
No Comments
Extremly boring and monotone, test were not hard as long as you study.
great class, excellent clear teaching style
Boring, Boring, Boring.  Difficult to stay awake and pay attention.  Tests were very challenging to prepare for.
Lectures are jam-packed full of info... sometimes too much. He takes the class to an elementary level... it's pretty dry, but he's a good prof.
Hated this man and this class!  Too hard to follow his verbal lectures.  He was the most boring man!!
the best professor I've had at OSU!
Loves to hear his own voice and treats students like elementary kids.
No Comments
Lectures and quizzes are ok and fair.

I mean, there's a reason she's got such a high rating on this site. Easily the best professor I've ever had. She knows the material, she loves the material, she's fantastic at teaching the material, she makes you work, she wants you to learn the material, the tests are very fair and easy (If you've read everything and go to class).

Dr. Hunt knows the material very well. Two 4-page papers. One is a book review and the other is a movie review. No quizzes. Just easy midterm and final (which is not cumulative). Study guides look exactly like the exams. She's very nice too and replies quickly to emails. She has an accent but very clear and understandable.

Very nice and helpful; responds to emails within the day it was sent, clear and concise with material. She knows and has a passion for what she is teaching and is able to do teach a tough subject very well. I would recommend taking one of her classes 1010 times
Amazing Professor, very knowledgable and passionate in what she teaches. The course was very organized and she was  always available for help on assignments. I highly recommend taking this course
She is the best History teacher you can have. She knows everything and she just makes boring history so vivid and interesting!!

Professor Hunt is incredibly knowledgeable and passionate. She clearly loves teaching and the subject matter she teaches on. Her class was very well organized and while it certainly requires some effort (doing the out of class readings), if you put in the effort you will do well.

Dr. Hunt is a super cool , super nice. She's very smart & really knowledgable about the subject. She uses videos and movies to assist with understanding the material.Gives quiz questions in advanced and questions are EXACTLY like the homework. As long as you come to class and do the Homework you'll get an A. Finals is easy & she's a fair grader

She knows what she's teaching by heart and she's passionate about it. You are going to learn a lot from her about the early society. The class is interesting; she showed videos and brought Mediterranean foods for us. This subject is easy if you do the homework and complete the assigned readings. I really enjoyed her class. Thumbs up !

Dr. Hunt is extremely organized. Even if you're not interested in the topic, she will make it interesting with movies and primary sources. I would recommend this class to anyone needing the credit. I personally took it even though I didn't need the credit and I'm glad I did. It's not *EASY* but as long as you do the work you will do well.

Professor Hunt is a wonderful teacher who truly cares about all of her students passing her class. She reviewed all of my essays before I turned them in and gave really useful feedback. She expects you to know the material through and through but all you have to do is ask and she will help you every step of the way. I absolutely LOVED her.

Dr. Hunt is one of the best professors that I have had. She truly cares about helping her students understand the material and succeed. She is very knowledgeable about the topics covered and is able to teach them in a fair and objective way. This course has greatly improved my insight into world history.
Most organized professor I've had.

Dr. Hunt is truly a phenomenal professor and this class provides students with a strong understanding of Islamic history throughout many time periods. She truly cares about students learning the material. If you show up to class, do the reading, and pay attention, Dr. Hunt will make sure you do well in her class.

A great professor, has all the qualifications to teach the course at a very understanding level. The course is structured in a way that will let students explore the subject in the proper way yet ease the burden. Overall, if you keep up with class and discussion and do the required work you will do fine in the class. Definitely recommend!

She is an amazing instructor. Very passionate about Islamic and Balkan history. She is very compassionate with her students, and wants them to actually learn something from the class. If you are interested in learning about Islamic History, then this class will provide you with a great intro on the subject. I recommend taking the class!
I highly recommend this professor; she is very helpful, fair and engaging. This class will give you a better understanding of Islamic history.
Lots of work (reading), but if you do it all you will do well.

Dr.Hunt was an amazing professor. She truly helps you understand your material and is always ready to help you achieve the maximum potential in class. She truly has a kind heart, a rarity in professors these days. Her depth of knowledge is truly amazing which makes her class that much more interesting and engaging.

I was out of school for over 8 years. This course got my focus back. Professor Hunt was very knowledgable about the subject and displayed confidence when teaching her class. She provided clear cut instruction on her syllabus as well as everyday in class, and was available to help her students at all times via email in addition to office hours.

Dr. Hunt is an extremely knowledgable and helpful teacher. Instead of focusing on memorization of the text book, she focuses on the understanding of primary documents and their relation to one another. By far this is the best history class that I have ever taking in regards to maintaining my intrest and the knowledge that I obtained.

Dr. Hunt is just great! She is so knowledgable and helpful. And also, with my personal experience, she is the fastest instructor to reply emails, with very helpful and valuable content, not just a quick answer. As long as you follow the syllables to do what you are supposed to do, you will be able to get a good grade! Btw, she makes great desserts!

Very interesting class. Excellent professor in every way. She is clear, sticks to the syllabus, very organized and extremely helpful. As any other history class you will need to read a lot, but if you keep up with the syllabus you will not have any problems.

I took this course to fulfill a GEC requirement. History is not really my area, but Dr. Hunt made this class very interesting and worthwhile. She was very clear and willing to answer questions and offer feedback. You have to be willing to do the readings for class, but they aren't bad. I would definitely recommend this class and professor!
She taught the course with absolute clarity and was easy to contact when I had questions during the course.
She is a great teacher who is willing to help you with papers and exams, and focuses more on  interesting primary documents rather than the textbook, which definitely enlivens the class.
Mrs. Hunt was a great teacher who graded fairly and had very interesting lectures. She was very informed on the topics and provided a plethora of awesome primary documents.
Professor Hahn is an amazing scholar on the history of US relations in the Middle East. His lectures are engaging, insightful, and always inspire great discussion. Take him if you have the chance!

Knowledgeable, intelligent, and wise. He is clearly an expert in the subject material. He engaged the students in dialogue as well. The readings are not mandatory and you can scrape by just completing the bare minimum, but you will get so much out of the class if you engage with the material. Go to class and you will learn so much from him.
Dr. Hahn is a superb professor. He is an expert on US foreign policy. His makes you work in this graduate level class. But the level of learning is well worth it.

Hahn met all of my expectations for a history professor: In lecture, he delivers the content without going on tangents and without being boring. The slides were on Carmen, but it's necessary to attend for filler info, and he's tactful with student opinions For the midterms/essay, he's very clear with his grading criteria and fair with critiques.
Lots of notes for this class.  He is very organized and very clear.  If you like American History, this is a great class.

The hardest class at OSU is HIST 770 for all of you grad/doc students.  No amateurs.  They call the class "the sweatshop" because you have to read a thick-ass book and write a 4 page single spaced paper (not a book report but a comparison to other scholars etc) every week.  And give an oral report half of the weeks.  You will learn a****load and meet some great people if you can stick it out though.

If you lack a good background in American history(1920-present), definitely take a lower level intro. class first, otherwise you'll struggle majorly. LOTS of reading, but it's not necessary to read the subject specific books,BUT STUDY THE TEXTBOOK EXTENSIVELY. Class = a note taking marathon.
Had lots of interesting info to impart, but somewhat dry. Very notes-intensive class, not particularly helpful to students in small setting, but still knows his subject.
Lectures impecably organized, very knowledgeable, great sense of humor.
No Comments
Very thorough, interesting, one of the best classes I've taken at OSU

Dr. Limbach is nice and wants to see you succeed, but his class was just hard to follow. There were no slideshows, just lectures and the lectures were just him reading off a script that was hard to follow at times. His grading system also is anxiety-inducing because he decides your final grade based on numerous criteria.
He was fine as a professor, but it always baffled me that he used a Kindle(???) to read off of a script for every class.

Understanding that this historical period is broad, I wish I could give him more leeway on his score, but I can't. He reads off a script for his lectures and jumps around way too much. I don't think I truly retained anything from his lectures. The class lacks passion and clarity. Also, his grading system is weird and creates more anxiety.

This class was broken down into 7 modules (1 for each week) that included two of either a discussion board, document analysis, or individual reflection based off of the textbook. Lots of reading and you pretty much cant avoid it if you want to end up with a good grade. Professor didnt interact with the class much outside of module intro videos.

Both this professor and class were super easy. I will say, he doesn't really give 100% on anything, he will say that you did a great job and still give you 9/10 points. One weekly assignment to do and I would recommend buying the textbook so you can highlight inside it. I found that I could usually skim the chapters and still earn a good grade.

class is very textbook heavy. there were 3 assignments a week and they were not clear about what they wanted or expected. never stated a word min or max. the midterm was not clear at all. and the weekly lectures did not do anything for the class. this class would be better taught without a professor and someone just telling you to read the book.

Reasonably tough with grading assignments as you have to read the textbook well, but Prof Limbach has clear standards. He posted an example of how to get a perfect score on an assignment which was helpful.

I took this online (asynchronous) as a session 2 course, and it was a fairly easy for history GE. It was broken up into one module per week (2 assignments weekly). Honestly, yes you need the textbook, but I barely read and ended the course with an A-. If you read some, youll do just fine.

Pretty easy history gen ed. He requires a textbook as his assignments are based on it. His class is broken into modules and each model has a group discussion and either an individual reflection or document analysis of what we read. Each module covers about two chapters (7 modules in total) which is not bad at all. Class is also asynchronous.

Amazing professor and I don't mean that lightly. He was a very busy man but when he was in class and lecturing, he was engaged and you could tell his passion is very much there. I think it's important to note that this class is very engaging and you must pay attention to all material to understand. Lots of reading, movie watching and typing/writing

If you go to class and take good notes during lectures the exams will be easy! The "homework" is a lot of reading and documentaries, but your grade is just exams and a couple of super simple pop quizzes. The only stressor is that he is super disorganized and the way he uses Carmen is confusing.

Only graded on 3 exams, participation, and a final.This class requires a lot of time.There are many readings and videos to watch, although they are very interesting. You will learn a lot in lecture. Honestly not the easiest GE to take. Will need to establish a good schedule to watch movies and read weekly. Great professor,as he is very engaged.

I love Dr. J. This class was stimulating and easy as long as you participate in discussions and can write. Only 6 assignments. 3 1-page film reflections & 3 5-page film analyses. No textbooks, no readings, just films. Couldn't recommend him and this class more. He's also gracious with deadlines if you participate in discussions.

Dr. J's awesome. His course material was comprehensive, and I learned things about the Civil Rights and Black Power movements that are incredibly relevant modern day. Lots of readings, but they're interesting and informative. Dr. J cared about our thoughts and opinions; he facilitated extremely valuable discussions during class and office hours.

Dr. J is a true homie. he's absolutely hilarious and loves students speaking and demonstrating their personality in class! He's also very passionate about teaching and clearly cares about his students. He keeps the course interesting not only in the content and interesting lectures, but giving us a mixture of readings and documentaries.
